Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Albucasis begins his treatise as follows: 
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, my children, now that I have completed this book for you, which is the ultimate guide to medical science, achieving its goal at its end and with its explanations and clarifications, it seems fitting to me to present this treatise on surgery to you as part of the practical aspect of medicine.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Since manual surgery is neglected in our region and our time, to the extent that it endangers medical science itself, and its remnants are suppressed; only a few brief descriptions remain in the books of ancient scholars, which have been distorted by others leading to errors and hesitancy, as their minds are closed and their abilities stunted.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	It is my intention to revive and organize this treatise according to a systematic approach of explanation, clarification, and concision; additionally, through illustrations of cautery tools and other surgical instruments as well as with supplementary descriptions and preparatory steps, which are essential prerequisites for the procedure.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The reason why skilled artisans are lacking in this field during our time is that the art of medicine is lengthy and demands a prior extensive knowledge of anatomy so as to understand the nature of body parts, their forms, how they connect and separate; bone structure, nerves, tendons, their numbers, origins and insertions points; pulsating and quiet veins, as well as the locations where these may be found.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this reason, Hippocrates says that its name is great, but in practice it is small, and especially in the skill of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already mentioned this in the introduction of this book; for one who is not knowledgeable about what we have discussed regarding anatomy, may fall into error and cause death to many people, as I myself have seen numerous such individuals, who are learned in theory but lack practical knowledge and experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	I witnessed a foolish and inexperienced physician accidentally cut into an abscess with scrofulous characteristics on a woman's neck; he severed some arteries in the neck, causing a great flow of blood, and as a result, the woman bled to death while her maids held her.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	I saw another physician who was about to remove a stone from a man's bladder; the stone was large and it damaged his viscera during the procedure, ultimately causing his death three days later.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	I was called upon to remove it, but I knew from the stone's size and the patient's condition that he would not survive.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	Here is the translation of the first source sentence: 
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called upon to untie their bonds; the result of my work is tranquility and thus lessening of his pain.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, when corruption has already spread to the limb and cannot be stopped, it continues to circulate within the affected member until the patient is in danger.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another physician who punctured a cancerous abscess, which became ulcerated after several days and caused the lord to become more seriously ill.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The reason for this is that the cause of cancer is usually an excess of melancholy humor; therefore, it is not necessary to treat the entire body with iron, but only those limbs where such treatment is required.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, my children, it is necessary for you to divide the operation into two parts: one part that is associated with health and another more dangerous part.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already indicated this in every part of this book where the operation is mentioned because it contains error and danger; therefore, you must keep such cases separate so that they do not come to light and discredit you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And so, take up your weapons with solicitude and under God's protection; treat your patients with ease and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	Use the best method, by God's grace, leading to salvation and praiseworthy recovery; leave behind those terrible diseases that are difficult to cure, and keep your weapons away from anything that makes you fearful, so that doubt does not escape your faith and your name: for greater is what remains of your glory, both in this world and beyond among your saints.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	The wise man has already said in some of his teachings:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat an illness with evil means, lest you be called evil doctors.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Here begins the division of the book, and first of the first part:
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter deals with the instruments of surgery, including those needed for cauterization and their various forms, along with other necessary tools for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter deals with cauterization, piercing, cupping, wounds, and the extraction of arrows or similar objects; all carefully outlined along with instructions for the required instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter is about restoration and dislocation, treating sprains and similar injuries. It focuses on the head and feet and outlines the necessary instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Cauterization with fire, medicinal sharp points, and recalling the surgical procedure.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With this it begins the treatise of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I want to explain the quality of the iron for that cautery and the documents related to it, as well as in which condition it is prohibited to perform cauterization.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	So I say that the discourse on the quality of cautery iron and its documents is long and prolix, subtle in knowledge, and hidden in secrecy; many wise men have spoken about it before and they disagree, so for me, a little of their discourses will suffice, fearing prolixity.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And thus I say that you will apply the cautery to all general complications, which are with matter or without matter, except for two complications, which are causative complications without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the case of a dry and cold complication with matter, there is disagreement; some say that cauterization is beneficial, while others argue the opposite, stating that cautery is not suitable for illnesses caused by qualities and dryness because the nature of fire is characterized by heat and dryness, which are counter to what is required to heal an illness that is dry and cold.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And he who argues against this, stating that cautery is indeed beneficial for all dry and cold illnesses found in the human body, does so because when you compare the human heart and its moisture to the composition of fire, you find the human heart to be colder.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say this based on the words of the aforementioned individual; my own experiences have already proven this to be true.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not appropriate to delve into this further for those who have already thoroughly explored and practiced the art of cauterization in previous chapters; they are aware of the diverse complications that arise within the human body, the disposition of illnesses in their organs, the causes behind them, as well as the varying symptoms and durations of these illnesses.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	Here is my translation of the provided medieval medical treatise: 
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	Furthermore, the action of caustic medicine extends to those parts of the body that are remote from it, and it quickly causes an illness in the affected limb that is difficult to cure and often fatal.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, because of its sublimity and the goodness of its substance, does nothing but make [something] superfluous. And it is already known to us through experience and through lengthy service in studying the art for the truth of the causes; and for this I am excused from lengthening my speech. And if it were not that my book is not read by these indolent people in this remote place, which you keep secret with fire, and the quality of its operation in the bodies and its expulsion through which it expels diseases, [I would] speak philosophically demonstratively, which would sharpen your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And you should know, my children, that they disagree about the time when it is appropriate to perform cauterization and consider spring to be a better time for it.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cauterization is appropriate at all times because the harm caused by delaying it due to weather conditions is outweighed by the benefit gained from what is drawn out by the cautery. And this is especially true for pains or necessary evils, such as abscesses and fistulas, which cannot wait without risking greater harm, as a small present evil is preferable to a larger future one caused by delay.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And this is not found in your books, my sons, for it is only valued by the common people and foolish doctors; that illness which has been healed with a caustic [remedy] never returns at all times, but they neglect that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Furthermore, apply superfluous cauterization in a medical setting due to the haste of its recovery and the potency of its therapeutic action as well as the greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible for the illness to recur at any time according to the constitution of the patient and the location of their ailment, as well as their health, the state of their body regarding superfluities in it, what has been prepared within them due to the aggregation of superfluities, and what they have acquired through food and similar causes; unless the disease for which cauterization is administered is a delicate one with few superfluities and humors, like toothaches and similar cases, it is unlikely that the pain will return. However, this should be done carefully in small amounts.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	The common saying is that cauterization is the last resort in medicine, and this is true according to medical professionals; they believe it is not a cure that benefits from medicine or any other cause except for cautery itself.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	The reason for this is the opposite; the intention behind calling cauterization the last resort in medicine is not always accurate. It depends on how cure methods are administered to certain illnesses and whether those medicines have been effective or not. Only when other treatments fail, at the end of the process, should one administer cautery, and it may indeed benefit the patient.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And here we find that cauterization is the last resort of medicine, not according to the understanding of laymen and too many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	The ancients said that cauterization with gold is better than iron, and they say this only due to the equality of gold and the excellence of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the site of cauterization is not weakened, even if this is not absolutely true, for I have proven it and found that it does so only in some bodies without others; thus, cauterization with gold is good and better than iron as they say. However, when you perform cauterization using fire from gold, one must be careful because the amount of heat generated by the gold depends on its quantity due to the roughness of the gold, and it must be prepared to receive moisture; if you expose it to too much flame, the gold will melt with the fire, which is useful for the artisan who wishes to work with it.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this reason, one must practice cauterization with iron more lightly and precisely to achieve the correct operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	I have already organized this chapter on cauterization according to the chapters, and I've placed those related to the head among the feet, so that when one seeks a specific topic in it, they may find it easily.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization process introduces humidity and coldness into the brain, which is an accidental occurrence caused by two factors: one being sodden flux and the other being a multitude of traumatic flux, known as 'corissa', affecting the head and leading to discharges from body parts such as the ears and legs. It also results in excessive sleepiness, toothaches, and throat pain. Generally speaking, it causes all illnesses stemming from coldness, including paralysis, soddening (edema), apoplexy, and similar conditions.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The procedure for this cauterization is as follows: Firstly, instruct the patient to take a laxative medicine that will cleanse their head over three or four nights, depending on the strength of the patient's constitution and their age.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	Then tell the patient to shave their head with a razor and have them sit on a chair with their arms extended between two others' arms, while placing his hands on his own legs.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	Then place the edge of your palm's razor blade close to their nose, right between their ears.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, once you have reached the middle of your finger's location, mark that spot with a tent and then use an olive-wood cautery like this:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieva ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel. 
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it over the area, leaving it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then place on him a poultice made of clay mixed with vinegar, and leave it there until the skin is destroyed by the fire.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the wound with four-herb ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they say that when the Roman plague broke out, a better remedy was found with a mixture of garlic and oil, for it is more effective and beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the spine should be cauterized at the base of the bone, and the cautery should be held there until some part of the surface layer of the bone adheres.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	Then scrape away that which has adhered to the bone, and treat it afterward.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that the cautery should be brought to the back and applied with strong pressure until it burns into the bone deeply. This is the form of small alpecin (type of medication):
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They believe that vapours from this place escape to the head.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And if the wound remains open for a long time, then it should be treated before it becomes hardened.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I have never seen these two types of cauterization used at all, but only in some cases out of fear; leave that, it seems to me, and prioritize the patient's well-being when it is necessary, for the head becomes weakened due to the interruption of continuity as we have mentioned with other body parts, especially when the patient's head is of a more sensitive nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	The first type of cauterization is safer and better in my opinion; this method should be used, as it promotes the patient's recovery.
Capitol segon.	It seems that you may have accidentally included a portion of text from another source. Please provide additional context or information if you would like me to translate, summarize, or assist with any other task!
Del cauteri del cap.	On the topic of head cauterization.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When there is persistent and long-lasting pain in the entire head of a patient that persists for an extended period, various treatments are applied such as herbs, cochias (a type of medicine), purgatives, ointments, poultices, baths, crows (possibly referring to a specific treatment or bird-related remedy), and similar remedies. If cauterization has already been performed with a hot iron but none of these methods provide relief, consider whether the patient's head is naturally strong and resistant due to its robust nature; if it is not fragile and experiences intense heat, then proceed with another round of cauterization using a different cautery instrument, applying it beneath the previous one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	Then cauterize that area over his skull with a hot iron, while the iron is still divided in two parts (not fully cooled down).
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the divided iron and expose it from its wooden handle to the measured length we described earlier, then cauterize that area with a hot iron at the back of the head in the spot known as the vessel - this is the location where a cupping glass would be placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	But lift your hand quickly during that process, without uncovering the bone, because the patient will experience an intense pain unlike any of the other head cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	Here is the translation of the provided source sentence: 
Capitol ters.	Capitolo terzo." or "Chapter three.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the cauterization of non-ancient hemorrhoids.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is a severe pain in the temples or the pain extends into the eyes, first evacuate with medicines that purify the head, and administer other treatments I have mentioned for different diseases; if all of these do not help, then cauterization on them can be done in two ways: either with acute, corrosive medicine, or with an iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	The first type of cautery using corrosive medicine is to take a cloth made of alum, and soak it in water; then cut the ends of its two corners.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then make an incision in the area of pain on the temple using a lancet, being careful to do it at the spot that was pointed out beneath the crown, taking care not to make it visible.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then press on it with a pad for some time using firm pressure, and leave it there for the space of three hours; then remove the cloth and draw out the alum, leaving the plaster in place for two or three days, and then apply to it cotton soaked in vinegar until the wound is healed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat him with ointment until he is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, apply some caustic medicines which I have written about in the second treatise on caustic medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Now proceed with the cauterization in this way: Take a cautery that has this shape:" (likely describing or illustrating the shape of the cautery instrument).
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	It is called a 'claus clavilhs,' because its head has the shape of a nail with a slight curve and a small raised point in the middle.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then place it on the painful area, keep your hand steady - so that the arc (of the cautery) below is not touched - and rotate the instrument slowly but swiftly.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	If the amount that adheres to the cautery's face is such that it covers half of it, lift your hand a little so that the artery below is not touched and thus there will be no bleeding.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then dip a cotton swab in salt water and place it on the area, leaving it for three days. After that, apply moistened cotton with ointment until healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you want to cauterize the end of the ulnar artery according to the cautery method, be careful not to make an incision into this rather modern external iliac artery.
Capitol quart.	Chapter four.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Regarding the cauterization of an ancient external iliac artery.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat the external iliac artery using what we have mentioned for previous treatments and considering the different diseases, if the treatment does not work, and sometimes due to the disease which is not enough for the first cautery with medicine or fire cauterization method, then you need to ignite a knife-shaped cautery until it becomes white hot; this means applying it on the pain location along the length line of half of your finger or that one; and place your hand once and press it hard before incising the arch and preventing it from hitting the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be careful not to damage the continuation of the mandible, which is important for chewing and that the ligament should not adhere nor pinch the nerve running through it, preventing spasm.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And regarding the custody and caution of blood flow from an incised artery, as there is a fear of this at the beginning of the operation, especially for those who do not know what they are doing and lack experience; leave the operation in them initially.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will provide a reminder of the treatment for accidental blood flow from archery wounds according to its manner, in this very book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this illness does not require such a strong treatment and the patient's body can tolerate it, cauterize them in the middle of their head as we have described before, and treat the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish to use the cautery we mentioned in the chapter on archery wounds with two irons, know that this is the better and more effective treatment.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5: Of Wounds from Iron or Stone
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the treatment of earaches.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the ear due to cold and it is treated with laxatives and other remedies as mentioned before, but the pain persists, then apply the following cautery treatment. This type of cautery is called 'punctual', and its shape is...
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then proceed to apply the fire by making small circular motions all around the ear or at each specific point if pain is localized.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Along with the cautery of the root of the ear, gradually as you have marked the place with ink.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery of these points covers the entire ear, and those that follow it, then treat the places in between so they are healed.

De cauterizacio de turtura.	Concerning the cauterization of torture." 
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Certainly! Let me provide you with the translation of each line into English: 
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cautery on the opposite side of the affected area, for relief will only come from the part that appears to be healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The method of cauterization is as follows: you cauterize it with the cautery on the right side of the top of the ear, placing a small piece over the crown of the head, and another on the temple, its length being equal to the length of your pinky finger. Then, place your hand holding the cautery so that the amount burned is equivalent to half of the width of an apple seed.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	This is the shape of the cautery, which is similar to that of a knife, its front side being flat.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it is slightly more delicate than that; it should have a little less thickness in superfluous crudeness.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the area with what is previously processed so that it is healed.

De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	The title of the seventh chapter is "On the Cauterization of Old Apoplexy." 
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot. E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	The way of using the cautery is done as previously mentioned.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	The cautery has already been applied to the opening of the stomach, and now it is time for the second part; then treat it with what you have at hand.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 5.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On the cauterization of forgetfulness done with flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Give the patient in the beginning large cups of wine and pills with fresh eggs.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then shave the entire head of the patient and place on their skull a plaster as described in the treatise about plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And leave some intervals blank; this is how one makes the cautery.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	Do this as often as you think it's necessary, following the order I have previously stated.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And so if they are cured by this, it's good; but in the opposite case, then do to them three cauterizations on the back part of their head, which descend from that uppermost portion of the head until you reach the lowest point of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place something with the thickness of a finger between each cautery, then treat the cautery with what has come out.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	If you wish to treat the patient and their illness is tolerable, then perform cautery on one place only; but if it is more severe, cauterize them over both hips.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat it until it is healed; and let the shape of the cautery be an olive, as given in the form above.

De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the cauterization of parasites and softening of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Take care that you proceed with the softening of the head with irons and what we have said; then shave the patient's head, and cauterize it with a single cautery on top of their head, two cauteries over both temples, one at the back of their neck, and three more on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the illness of softening the body due to excessive humors and tolerable patients, but the illness is severe, then cauterize them with four cauteries on their vertebrae, finally use a cautery that has been heated by hot coals from the fire, and lift your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then treat that wound until it is healed, and let this be an olive oil cautery.

De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Here is my best attempt at translating each sentence: 
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma." 
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And so it is necessary to modify the patient's brain at the beginning with years and another cure that we have mentioned in the division, when the illness is severe and can tolerate the exception of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if the child does not tolerate medicines, then administer gargles and chewable medicated substances that modify the brain; this should be done for several days, with the improvement of their diet.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then scrape the top of the patient's head and cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of their scalp as mentioned before. Use another cautery on their occipital bone (the back of the skull), and cauterize each corner or side of the head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	If the patient is strong and can tolerate it, then use the aforementioned cauteries to cauterize him/her after applying paralysis and softening of the body on the vertebrae of their neck and back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	Use an olive-shaped cautery as previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	However, if the patient is a child, then use a delicate or small-sized cautery in this manner.

De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Based on the provided text, it seems like you might be interested in learning about the ancient practice of cauterization for treating melancholia or depression. Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then raise the patient's head, and then make a comfortable pillow for them using clothing, and then place that under their head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient is completely bedridden, unable to move from any part of their body.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then apply a liniment; it is more appropriate to use old sheep fat for this.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	Heat it over the fire to warm it up appropriately, which is done according to the patient's tolerance.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then put it in the middle of their head on top of a pillow, and leave it there until it cools down.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	Do this to the patient once a week and administer another treatment until they are cured; or if you wish, cauterize them with small points depending on their age, but make sure to hold a cautery in your hand that has been properly prepared: this is a special kind of cautery that moistens the brain evenly.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then apply this clot soaked in sheep fat or goose grease.

De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel." 
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have identified the onset of water in the brain through the signs I mentioned earlier in my explanation, then begin and give the patient to drink that which changes their head, and protect them from all humidity.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And let it soak in warm water for some days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then instruct them to shave their head and cauterize it with a cautery on the top of their skull; then cauterize it with two cauteries over both temples if there is an onset of water in both brains, or from one side if there is an onset of water in one brain.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Incise with a cautery all the veins and arteries that are under the chain; and let these cauteries be in such length at the latitude of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And protect yourself from blood flow when you are cauterizing; and if you see that there is blood flowing from them, remove it with whatever medicine is available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will come with the wisdom which is in extraction of arteries and by their excision, and caution against blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized at the nape of the neck with two pointed cauteries that are made immediately.

De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Regarding the cauterization of old tears." 
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears of the eyes are ancient frequently and pass through the veins and arteries which are in the visible part of the head outside, and it is verified that this is superfluous phlegmatic humors, then cauterize that with a cautery which we have recounted in the chapter about boiling water on the eyes, and with two cauteries in the middle of the head, and two more cauteries below the temples on both sides, and two cauteries below the bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you need additional treatment, then cauterize that area in the entire region of the tail of the eye above the edge of the eyelid with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14. 
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat the patient with what we have discussed in the previous section and their condition does not improve, you prepare and give them an herbal drink made from cockle for three nights. Then, shave their head and apply a medium-sized cautery, followed by an olive-sized one.

E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	Be cautious not to burn or damage the surrounding area during the cauterization process.

E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	Do not press the cautery too hard against your hand, but rather with just enough force to adhere the third part of the eyelid.

De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Regarding the eyelid of an infant, when hairs have grown within its slit-like palm, use a pointed cautery.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When hairs grow within the palms of an infant to such an extent that I prick them with a needle, there are two ways in which one can cauterize it: either by using fire or caustic medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you cauterize with fire, ask the infant to fix its gaze on something as if it were looking at those who comb its hair, while they are pulled and plucked; and if I hold it by the nose, then you must bind the child's hands with a cloth so that it may not be hurt any further until the hairs have been burnt.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Therefore, when the patient is born and baptized, place their head on your lap, then gently press down on their eyelid with your finger, making a sign resembling the shape of a myrtle leaf; this mark should start near the eyelashes.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then place a cold compress made of pigeon dung or crushed feathers on their eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then ignite the cautery, which should be shaped like this:" (likely followed by an illustration or description of the tool's shape)
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Now cauterize the marked area in small, invisible dots, gradually burning away the surface of the eyelid until it appears like a myrtle leaf.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The sign of successful treatment is when you see the patient's eyelid contract and their eyelashes rise due to the needle puncture.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And so, lift your hand and leave the patient alone for three days; then place a compress made of fresh dung on them until the wound has healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then treat any remaining issues with ointment until they are cured.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if it returns through the hair for some reason, and their eyelid softens, then do the cautery again on that spot just as you did initially.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hair is on their eyelid, remove it and cauterize that area so that it heals properly and does not cause irritation.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	The cautery with caustic medicine is what you should apply when the hair is long and has grown thick; make a piece of cloth in the shape of a myrtle leaf for this.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	Then take one ounce of known and living tar, or wax, and mix these ingredients well together to prevent it from cooling down too quickly; spread this mixture over the cloth in the shape of a myrtle leaf and place it on your finger or both fingers; place under your finger cotton soaked in egg white, and have the patient's head rest upon your lap.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	Put your finger over the medicine and press it down lightly without rubbing too hard since the patient will feel a burning sensation from the medicine which is like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then place a bandage on the wound until the inflammation is gone, and then treat it with guaiac ointment or another that heals it.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And if necessary, you must carefully ensure that none of the medicine falls into the eye during your procedure. If after a few days, the eyelid becomes softened and something from the eyelashes gets into the eye, then repeat the application of the medicine on the affected part of the eyelid as done initially, and it will heal.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is how the leaf of myrtle looks like.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you should know that human eyes vary in size and smallness, so your procedure must be adjusted accordingly.

De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Regarding the cauterization of a fistula in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place a poultice made of feathers or horsehair on his wound.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Then prepare the cautery, which is shaped like this:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	It should be hollow, shaped like a reed or an eagle's feather, with the cautery made at one end.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish to penetrate further, do so from the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want it to emerge again, make an exit as you would with a probe.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, one that is hollow will serve better for the task at hand.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	Then press on the fistula if it is open, trying to make it healthy and dry.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then make an incision to remove any hardened matter within.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place the well-lit cautery on it, and you must hold that with your hand a little below the cautery of the wound towards the nose, so as not to miss your aim or disturb the patient, then apply the cautery to the edges of the wound and burn them.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat. There is another way to cauterize a fistula which the first ones said: go to the place of the fistula and open it; then put in that fissure a thin thread-like candle whose shape is like this, And put into that one ounce of melted lead; then have your hand steady with care so that the patient doesn't suffer because the melted lead gets into his wound. You should apply on the patient's wound cotton soaked in egg white or water since the lead hardens the place of the fistula and heals it miraculously.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about the cauterization and cure, it's good; but if not, then it is necessary to administer a nasal syringe and reduce the fistula into the nose according to its appropriate place.

De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cauterization of teeth and on softening arteries.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When arteries are softened due to moisture and teeth become aggravated, treating them with medicines is ineffective. Place the patient's head in your lap, then prepare the cautery tool of the shape described here, insert the cautery quickly into the tooth with a metal rod, and hold it there until the heat reaches the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then remove your hand, and repeat this process with the cautery tool several times as you see fit.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then instruct the patient to rinse their mouth with salt water and hold it there for an hour; after that, let them spit out the liquid since the aggravated tooth is sealed, the softened gum is hardened, and any corrupting moisture has been dried up.

De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	De cauterisacio de dolor de dent." 
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to coldness or the presence of worms or frost, and it cannot be treated with medicine, then cauterization is performed in two ways: either with cow dung or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization with cow dung involves taking fresh cow dung and wrapping it around the end of an iron rod or stick. Then you dip this wrapped rod into the hot cow dung and quickly place it on the painful tooth until it is cooled down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	Repeat this process several times until the healing properties of the fire reach the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you prefer, immerse a woolen cloth or cotton in the aforementioned cow dung, place it over the aching tooth, and hold an ignited iron rod above it until the heat reaches the depths of the tooth cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, be cautious when using fire cauterization, especially with patients who have metal fillings or dental work, as the intensity of the heat may not reach the oral cavity due to the presence of these metallic obstructions.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Shape the cauterizing iron to fit the tooth, place it on the tooth and hold your hand over it until the iron cools down. Repeat this process several times over the course of one or two days until the pain subsides.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And now, let the patient fill their mouth with good saliva by pressing on the cautery [instrument], and let them hold it there for an hour, after which they should spit [the saliva out]; this is how the cauterization process works.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	Cauterize whatever extremity you see fit according to your judgement.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	This is how the cannula should be used:

De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Regarding the cauterization of external tumors:
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When external tumors are caused by an excess of phlegm and cold humors, and they do not respond well to medicinal treatment but their digestion seems slightly improved, you should use a cautery in the following manner: it should have two open ends with one for smoke expulsion; apply this ignited instrument to the tumor once, and if further treatment is needed, ensure you do not go deeper than the base of the tumor.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	If the tumor is small in size, then apply the cautery accordingly and let it remain for three days; place a piece of cotton soaked in saliva over the wound until it has healed from the fire's burn.

E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	The shape of the cannula or cautery should be cone-like.

De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Regarding the cauterization of vocal cords and the treatment of narrow airways." 
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When moisture affects the root of the lung and this is due to an alteration in complexion, it will be necessary at first that he be evacuated with laxatives; then cauterize there what they call the larynx on the affected side.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And be careful not to touch the larynx with the cautery or burn its cord, only slightly.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	Cauterize there with another cautery at the junction of the neck in the last vertebra behind him.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	And let your cautery be nailed according to the preceding manner.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	Then cure him with what has been prescribed before he is healed.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	On the cauterization of lung diseases and coughs.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When coughs and lung diseases are due to cold moisture, the patient has neither fever nor expectoration of blood, and it is an old disease, then cauterize him with two cauteries on both sides above the joint in the depressed places called leontii and boyci; and another one in the middle of his foot between the two mammilla bones; and let your cautery be nailed as previously shown.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, use the cautery called 'puncta' for your cauterization process, which is shaped similarly to that used in the treatment of earaches.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And if there are points on the patient's skin, then treat them with whatever remedy is prescribed beforehand for healing.
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And once you have the cautery, which has three sides, the cauterization can be done with it. You can make three cauteries in this shape:

De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On the cauterization of the 'titillic', which is the top of the assistant's head." 
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the helper is dislocated due to slippery humidity and is not firmly held during its return movement, it must be guided back into place as it usually returns on its own. Then, with a small movement, gently pull it towards you as we have shown; now you need to reduce the dislocation first by reversing the patient onto their back or side; then raise your forearm from inside the armpit upwards until you reach above the elbow of your left hand if the joint is dislocated inwards.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	Then take the double-pointed cautery; this is how it looks like...
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	Now cauterize the forearm making sure it penetrates on the other side, and you will get a four-pointed cautery when done.
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And make it delicate according to the amount of flesh; this is how it looks like...
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	In some cases, the count is adjusted accordingly, and that is because there were eight cauteries.
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	Then place the cautery on top with warm brine, then let the patient rest, and do not move that body part for some time until it is comfortable again.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	When the dislocation is in the upper parts of the body and this procedure is performed, then use a pointed or multiple-point cautery on the muscle. Because the joint is confirmed (or aligned), moisture is reduced, and the patient recovers.
