De cauterizacio del stomac.	De cauterizacio del stomac.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When stomach pain is caused by excess moisture and the disturbance of its natural composition, leading to a buildup of waste in the body, if you continue with the treatment methods without consulting an expert, it is advised that the patient be placed on their back, arms and legs extended. Then cauterize the area with three cauteries: place one cautery below the feet, the size of a thumb with small nails, and two more cauteries on either side of this, forming a triangular shape; ensure they are not too close to each other as this will cause burning.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cauterization is equivalent to about two-thirds of the thickness of your little finger.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	The shape of the cautery should be designed as follows [draw], and if you wish, you may also use a larger cautery placed in the middle of the stomach with this circular shape.
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat. De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri." translates to "For the perforation of abscesses in the liver, use a cautery tool." 
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When an abscess forms in the kidney and you want to determine if it is within the kidney's tissue or its membrane, if it is in the tissue of the kidney, the patient will experience increased weight gain and pain.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if the abscess is within the kidney's membrane, the pain becomes severe and often tires out the doctors treating it.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	Therefore, have the patient turn onto their side and locate the spot of the abscess; then ignite the cauterizer which was assembled with rags as shown on the previous page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	Cauterize the abscess with said cautery until all its matter has been burned away; do this before any healthy tissue is reached or damaged.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the patient for other abscesses until they are healed as well.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And it is not necessary to use this form of cauterization unless the one studied in medical arts is prolonged; and that has proven useful for many diseases; however, you should experiment with this operation a few times first as it can be quite harsh on the patient's body but will heal better.

De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	On the cauterization of the mouth.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When you treat the patient's mouth disease with what we have mentioned regarding treatment division and do not observe improvement, then cauterize it according to three methods; all are correct and one of them is performing 3 or 4 linear cauterizations along the length of the mouth as was described for liver cauterization.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	And the distance between each two cauterizations is the width of a finger or slightly more and the shape of the cautery should be similar to what was described for liver cauterization.
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And do not press your hand against the cautery; let the patient lie on his back.
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	There is another way to cauterize, which is by igniting the cautery with two vents, as we have previously mentioned in the chapter on muscle dislocation. Lift the patient's arm, which is on the side of the injury, and place it above their head.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	And let your elevation when lifting the arm be according to the length of the body, so that the cauterizations are made proportionally along the latitude of the body.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	Then introduce the two vents, ignite them quickly, as you insert the patient's other arm from the other side.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	Then withdraw the cautery; thus, four cauterizations have been made.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you wish to cauterize using a cautery with three vents,
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	Then take care of the cautery after it has stopped burning for too many days, as this is more comfortable for the patient than the other methods mentioned earlier in the treatment.

E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	Do not discharge the patient from care after the cautery is applied; instead, keep him for two more days to expedite his healing process.

The shape of the cautery used to burn the abdomen should be like a nail according to its previous shape, and that which is used for burning the back should be an olive branch according to what precedes it in form.

De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas."

When the feet are affected by edema and filled with yellowish water (edema), it is necessary to cauterize the feet on the top of the foot in the area between the index finger and ring finger; raise your hand with the cautery but do not twist it, then lift your hand without lowering it back down again because the yellow water will drain out.
Es le cauteri segon aquesta forma: E aprop fay sobre las doas coyssas dos cauteris, e en quascuna coysa sia feyt cauteri am la extremitat del cauteri cutellar. De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	About cauterization of the belly.
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris.	When the belly is full of phlegm and humidity that weakens the virtues, it is because the digestive and retentive virtue has been removed from the stomach and intestines. This condition is treated with curing methods but sometimes patients suffer from an expulsion of virtues during cauterization, so proceed to cauterize again using a large cautery on their stomach as previously done for the stomach cauterization, use the ring cautery and four small cauteries in the navel area; also use a pointed cautery. Finally use one or two larger cauteries over the navel.
E si vezes las humiditatz exhuberants e le malaute aquo tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le pentenilh e sobre les budels, e fort leu ajustant dos cauteris sobre l’estomac e prop dels inguonas, quar es curacio perficent de juvament de la qual no erras.	And if you see an abundance of humidity and the patient can tolerate it, then cauterize over the pubis and intestines; but apply two small cauteries lightly on their stomach near the groin area because this is a perfect cure that won't fail.

De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	About the cauterization of old hemorrhoids.
Quan so en la natura derier emorroydas antiquas o una de humors grossas fregas o de humiditatz corrompudas, e son curadas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no confereys la tieua curacio, lahoras cauterisa am tres cauteris sobre le pus dejos spondilh del dos petit e petit triangular, e am cauteri desus le ombelic cays per dos ditz. And use another two cauteries above the navel.

Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	Regarding the cauterization of hernias, proceed with their removal.
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you remove the hernia, ignite the cautery that is assembled like a ray (of light).
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	Then insert that ignited ray into the removed hernia and quickly place your hand over it before the cautery reaches the opening of the vein through which blood flows.
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Do this once or twice, but if there are too many hernias, cauterize each one as we have described and then cure them with the ointments you give to patients until they are healed.
E si cauterizas am gran cauteri sobre alquatin, es mays derier en juvament.	And if you cauterize with a large cautery on someone's body, it will be more severe later on.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	Regarding the cautery of fistulas that form naturally in the parts of the body.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When nature does not obey the operation we have described in its place (i.e., the rectum), and the patient is fearful because of this, cure them with a cautery.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	Therefore, when a fistula occurs in the anal region and is long-standing, causing corruption of healthy tissues and moisture, it is most appropriate to use a gentle probe to explore this condition. Then, with the aforementioned probe, determine the depth of the fistula.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Now ignite the cautery which is similar to a beam (of light).
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	Then place the ignited cautery into this fistula, according to the depth that the probe has reached.
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And repeat the process of applying the cautery as many times as necessary until those corrupted tissues are burnt away once or twice or three times, depending on how much is needed.
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	Be cautious of burning any nerves or veins; also, if the fistula goes towards the bladder's cavity or intestine's cavity, avoid those areas entirely. Do not perform this procedure unless the fistula is in fleshy tissue and you believe it to be non-penetrating.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the area until it heals.
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the wound is closed, having discharged all matter, and remains thus for a long time, then you may know that it has completely healed.
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	And if the matter is not removed from him, then know that it has penetrated into his bone or has corrupted his marrow; this is due to certain causes which will be mentioned later in their respective places.

De cauterizacio de la vesica.	Regarding the cauterization of the bladder.
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu. De cauterizacio de la mayra.	De cauterizacio de la mayra." translates to "Regarding cauterization for piles (hemorrhoids).
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.

De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	De cauterizacio de la dislocation de l'anqua.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When mucous moisture infiltrates the area of the hip joint and causes it to move out of its place due to this humidity, a sign of this condition is that one side of the buttock seems longer than the other when compared.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And if the location of the dislocation is found in the region around these joints...
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Then you must cauterize the patient in the area of their hip using a circular cautery, as you have marked with ink on this circle surrounding the affected joint and positioning the joint at the center of the circle.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And let this pointed cautery be used as was previously described for cauterizing the stomach.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	And if this pointed cautery is not available to you, then proceed with the cauterization using three large olive-shaped cauteries instead.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Perform the cauterization according to the level of severity indicated by your patient's entire condition, and then care for them until they are healed.

De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica translates to "On the cauterization of the sciatic vein." 
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain occurs in the hip region and is caused by coldness and moisture, treat the patient with what we have previously discussed and do not neglect this step, for it is an ancient practice. Then remove excess thick humors from the patient using foul-smelling pills or artificial/similar pills; cauterize that area afterward.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	The method of cauterization in this case follows two approaches: cauterization with burning medicines or cauterization with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	There are two scientific ways to proceed, one of which is to cauterize the patient's hip area using three triangular-shaped cauteries arranged like this; make sure they penetrate deeply.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	The distance between each cautery should be equal to the thickness of a finger, and the cauteries themselves can be either olive-sized or larger.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	In some cases, the cauteries may be placed on the top of the hip joint, making four cauteries in total.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	If you wish, cauterize using the circle that outlines the shape in the hip dislocation cauterization procedure; ensure it fully covers and burns away all roughness of the entire area.
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is how you perform cauterization on the hip when the pain is concentrated in the joint and has not spread to the groin.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	But if the pain has spread to the groin, then you will cauterize with two cauteries on the thigh, placing them over the area where the patient feels the most pain; and use one cautery on the calf, slightly below the back of the knee joint.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	If you use a cutting cautery, then the depth of the cauterization should be determined by the severity of the pain.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if the patient indicates that the pain has spread to their feet, then you will cauterize with three or four points of cautery here, or more if it is deemed necessary.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	If the patient indicates pain below the groin area, then you will use a cutting cautery here.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And be mindful during any cauterization that you do not burn any nerves or major arteries, for it could cause great harm to the patient.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	I have seen one or two people who were cauterized on the calf and, as a result of the procedure, their leg became swollen with fluid that accumulated in the foot, eventually bursting and causing gangrene throughout the entire foot.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And then there is a sudden release of fluids from the abdomen, and that brings death.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is felt in two different parts, cauterize each one following this method.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	The wise ones said that, for the cauterization of water, use a cautery tool like this: it should be shaped like a ring made of iron, with a circumference equal to half a palm; and its opening should be as wide as the bone of a date or slightly less.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	Inside that ring, place another third one; the space between them should be equal to the size of a thumb; these rings should be open on two sides; and the length of these rods should be one or two thumbs long. Make sure these rods are properly fitted with iron edges within the rings, and this is how it will look:
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Then ignite it in the fire until it starts to glow and spark, and place it on the affected area while the patient lies on their side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	Thus, you will cauterize it with three circular cauteries at once.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Certainly! Here is my attempt at translating each line into English while maintaining the original medieval style: 
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Diys Albucasis: Oh, my child, we have rarely used this type of cautery due to the fear it instills in patients, and consequently, few people practice it.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	May the good cauterization be upon those who endure it, and may it also heal their affected area.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	May the cauterization with adhesive medicines be for you to make two circles having an iron ring pierced in which the goose feather of a door hangs; be its length on the wall as long as two nuts or such.
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And if the space between any part is equal to the thickness of the finger; whether they are opened below or above, and that they contain each other in this way:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	Then place on the part of the ankle the patient lying on their side, and press your hand on the part of the ankle; then take boiling water and pour it between the two circles, and let its temperature be slowly reduced by the fire, keeping it there for an hour, and let the patient endure this biting and adhesion — as this biting is like that of fire — until the biting stops.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	And then lift your hand to the instrument and wipe away all the dirty water with clean water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	Then let him lie there for three days and place on it a poultice until the redness of the inflamed area subsides, and leave this for some days, and the inflammation will retreat; this is the last step in healing.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Then treat him with ointment until he is healed.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	And if the pain extends to the thigh or leg, make him stand in water as is done for the treatment of the hip equally.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	This is the method of dirty water, and I have already written about it in the treatise on medicinal rectification.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Take one part alkali and one part lime, both well extinguished, grind them together, and place them in a new pot with its bottom pierced by a small hole, according to the amount that fits into the tube.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	And place beneath the bottom of this pot another inverted pot, and pour over that alkali and quicklime some clean water which covers them by one finger, then press these with your hand tightly for good compression, and let the fluid that flows from the clean water into the lower pot.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	Then adjust all that water, and pour it over another live coals and other new alkalis, because then it will be of great use as a strong caustic agent, which is administered in many medical operations and in cauterizing other body parts, for the operation makes fire.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And for the caustic medicines, like vitriol, honey of cats, and vinegar with a taste similar to them, make sure they are mixed.
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	Guy recounts an operation and cure that healed a man's hip pain and sciatica; he praises it greatly, saying no other treatment is needed, as the patient was cured with this one procedure only, for the wound has healed completely, even though he bathed in ice-cold water immediately afterward.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	It should be close to green ivy, and if you can't find green ivy, take a fresh fig; grind it with a little grease and place it on the hip where there is pain or on the thigh or leg, then bandage it.
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	Leave it on for three hours or the amount of time that the patient feels relief from the tightness.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	And then place him in a bath; when his body is relaxed, put him on the ground, for the pain will cease and he will be healed.
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	And remember, it is not appropriate to use the cautery with these medicines but rather rely on the evacuation of the body.
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	Also, remember what the great physician, Escorides, said about using a goat's horn to cauterize the strait vein; it is advisable to do so when there are no other options available. The procedure should be carried out as follows: take wool and soak it in old oil, then place it between the toes of the foot and over the affected area.
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	Then take a dry goat's horn, ignite it until it becomes charcoal, and place it over the wool. Leave it there so that its heat spreads.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	Repeat this process and do not cease until the sensation of the sting reaches deep within; let the pain subside.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	This method of cautery is called "cauteri de vaquas," or cow's cautery.

De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.	De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.
Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida.	Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquellas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida. 
E cauteri no catz sino en aquesta sola specia la qual es fayta per efusio de materia frega.	And this cautery is used only for this specific purpose which is done by the effusion of cold matter.
Donc cove, aprop evacuacio del malaute am pillulas fitidas e am semblant a lor, que sian faytas sobre·l dos en le qual es la dolor tres linhas segon la latitut de lu, pus que senhas am tentha en quascuna linha v cauteris o mays, segon la quantitat que ve de la tolleransa del malaute e de la vertut de lu.	So now, proceed to evacuate the patient with foul-smelling pills and those similar to them, which are made specifically for three lines of pain across their back. Then make ten cautery marks on each line using either small or large cauterizations depending on how much the patient can tolerate and considering his virtue.
E sia fayta cauterizacio am cauteri de punt.	And do this cauterization with a pointed cautery.

De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	On the use of cautery at the beginning of jaundice." 
Motas veguadas endeve aquesta malautia als petitz enfantz; e senhal del comensament de lu en les enfantz es que accideys sobre lor estrectura en le ale eves la elevacio e·l movement.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E atrobas en le derier espondil del dos e dels notz de lu que ja comensa a sobremontar sobre les autres spondils.	And again [make an incision] at the last vertebra of the back and of its knots, which has already begun to rise above the other vertebrae.
E donc quan tu vezes aquo e voles prohibir, lahoras cauterisa aquel am cauteri que sia cercle segon aquesta forma:	And so when you see this [condition] and wish to prevent it, then cauterize that area with a circular cautery in the shape of:
que prengua le cauteri sobre tota partida del spondilh engualment.	which takes up the entire affected part of the vertebra likewise.
E si vols, cauteriza en le circuit del spondilh am le cauteri de punt dos linhas o tres.	And if you wish, cauterize in the surrounding area of the vertebra with the pointed cautery for two or three lines.
E sian les puntz propdas entre lor.	And ensure that the points are close to each other [when using the pointed cautery].

De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	Based on the provided text, this chapter or section appears to be titled "On the Cauterization for Gout and Joint Pain." It seems that the treatise delves into various medical treatments, with this specific part focusing on the use of cautery in addressing gout and joint-related issues. The previous sections you translated likely outlined the process and considerations involved in this treatment method.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament.	When joint pain is caused by frigid humours that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E donc cum es curada podagra de causa frega am manieyra de cura e no so remaugudas las dolors, lahoras las remau cauteri.	And thus, when gout caused by cold is treated but the pain is not relieved, then the treatment must be repeated with cautery again.
E es que tu cauterizas aquel aprop evacuacio en le circuit de la junctura del pe am motz cauteris.	And you will cauterize that area after the evacuation near the joint of the foot with several cauteries.
E sia cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And your olive-shaped cautery, which is shaped like this [draws an illustration of the shape]:
E si es necessitat que puntz sia fayt sobre la fassia del pe, lahoras fay am cauteri de punt.	And if it is necessary to make points on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery.
E si las dolors pujan entro als denolhs o a las autras juncturas, e aquo motas vetz s’endeve, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre quascun donolh am tres cauteris o quatre de tota partida am aquest cauteri olivar.	And if the pain spreads to the toes or other joints, and this sometimes happens, then cauterize that area over each toe with three or four cauteries on either side, using this olive-shaped cautery.
E si motz cauteris que aquestz cauteris sian a tu necessaris, lahoras cauteriza aquel e no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri abans, sia tant solament enviro la specitut de la codena.	And if it is necessary to use several of these cauteries, then do so and don't press the hand too hard against the cautery beforehand; only enough to cover the width of the cord.
E si las dolors pugan entro al donolh e·l dos, lahoras aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le sieu capitol.	And if pain spreads into the abdomen and back, apply the cautery method we discussed in the previous chapter.
E si las dolors so en las mas tant solament, e es apelada suagra, lahoras puncta en le circuit dels focils ayssi cum se revolvo, puncta en aquels dos linhas.	If the pain is only in the muscles and it's called rheumatism, then prick around the navel as you would for an umbilical hernia, pricking these two lines.
E si reman de las dolors en les ditz, lahoras puncta en le cercuit dels focils sobre quascun notz e sobre la pinche de la ma.	And if the pain remains in these areas, prick around the navel over each knot and also on the wrist of the hand.
E si las dolors pugan aprop alscus jorns als coydes o als muscles, lahoras cauteriza les quascus de tota part dels ajutoris.	If the pain spreads towards the knees or the muscles after a few days, then cauterize all parts of the joints.
E no evacuas le malaute de bon regiment e de recepcio de medicinas, quar si es fayt bon regiment e flacma es evacuada am aquest cauteri sira sanat, Dieus ajudan.	Do not discharge the patient from care without proper management and administration of medicine, for if good management is followed and the phlegm is discharged with this cautery treatment, God willing, they will be cured.

De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	Here is my translation of your provided text: 
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When there is a rupture in the inguinal region and the intestines are protruding through the opening before reaching the hernia, this process begins from here. In such cases, it is advisable to instruct the patient to refrain from consuming solid food on that day and adopt measures aimed at reducing inflammation for the wound to descend below their belly.
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	Then support the patient between your two hands on their back and instruct them to push their belly inward so that the hernia or intestines do not protrude through the opening.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	Then return him to the aforementioned position and feel for the rupture over the pubic bone, marking its extremity which resembles half a circle at the divided parts of the abdomen.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	Then take up the cautery, whose shape is as follows: [Please describe the form of the cautery here]
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	Which has a round handle and emits sparks when struck.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	Then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from coming out.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	You have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant is on their legs, and another one is on their chest holding their hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	Then place the cautery on that mark with your hand holding the cautery upright, and insert it so that you reach the bone of the pubic symphysis in the middle of the abdomen; repeat again if you have not reached the bone during the first attempt.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	Pay close attention to the position of the intestine during your cauterization process, ensuring you do not burn it, as this could lead to the patient's death or other severe harm.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	Be aware that if you do not reach the bone with your cauterization, it means your operation has been unsuccessful.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	Ensure that the cauterization for children is subtle, according to their size and proportions.
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	Then take care of the cauterization site for three days by applying an ointment so that the wound from the fire is cleaned.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Then take care of it with other medications until it is healed.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	Let the patient rest on their back for forty days so that the wound is sealed and healed.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	Make sure to provide the patient with nourishment according to their recovery time; if it is too quick, there might be intestinal prolapse due to straining during healing.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And when you want to get up after approximately forty days, then administer it appropriately and gently done, and keep him that way for another forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And he must refrain from labor and excess in diet, as well as from loud voices, for when he follows this entire regimen of treatment, he will certainly be healed.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And I will tell you about the treatment for ruptures in other parts of the abdomen, and if it is at the beginning and you want to prevent its extraction, then cauterize that rupture with a round cautery according to its size, just as in the third part of this book; and treat it with what we have said above, which is not suitable.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And I have already said that some prefer to cauterize ruptures with a triangular cautery according to this shape, because it is marked with thorns:" (followed by an illustration or description of the triangular cautery).
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	And a thread is placed across the width above the rupture and another line on top of it; then place your hand with a spiked cautery, but the first cautery is lighter and better.

De cauterizacio de torcio.	De cauterizacio de torcio.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When pain occurs in any body part due to injury or percussion and persists for a long time without responding to medicinal treatment, it is advisable to cauterize with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	The choice of the pointed cautery for any body part should be based on its size and fragility as well as the location of the injury and the intensity of pain.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	If the patient heals after the first cauterization, it is good; otherwise, repeat the process on them with a pointed cautery because, by custom, those pains are punctured from body part to another nearby until they are healed by cauterization.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	On the cauterization of leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Lepers are occasionally treated with a pointed cautery for great benefit; however, it is of little use against leprosy caused by the rotting of flesh and the presence of black bile.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	When you want to cauterize leprosy, consider whether it is contagious and apply the cure as we have stated in previous chapters; however, if you fear that corruption encompasses the entire body of the patient and their whole complexion, then cauterize them with five cauteries: one on the top of the head (on the median line), another underneath it, towards the front but below the hairline; two more on each side of the head (the horns) and a fifth behind, on the nape or neck.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	Certainly! Here is the translation of your source sentence: 
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas. E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And be careful of the nerves that are above the ankle, do not burn them.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	Sometimes, cauterization is done with a cautery over the bone of the little toe and another one on the mouth of the stomach, as well as on the liver.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	Know that the more closely you adjust the cauterizations, the more beneficial and effective they are; be aware that the patient does not feel pain from the cautery, just like their sores, because their body is already stupefied.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	Make sure that the cauterizations are large or small depending on the body parts and joints, according to what was previously mentioned regarding the types of tools.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the cauterized area with a mixture of flour from ants, honey, and another remedy until it is healed.

De cauterizacio de stupor.	It appears that the chapter title you provided translates to "On Cauterization of Stupor" in English. Would you like me to translate any specific sections or provide further information about this topic? I'm happy to assist!
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When any body part is paralyzed or numb and does not heal with medicines, oils, and plasters, you then cauterize that affected limb using cauteries appropriate for its size or smallness.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And let your cauterization enter the wound a little.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then treat him with ointment until he is healed.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And some swellings are cauterized with fire, which reaches the hands and feet, and to the vertebrae of the back; this protects the nerves that move those members, and the swelling is reduced.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	One should not presume to do this unless one is wise in the anatomy of the members and the emergence of nerves from throughout the body.

De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	On the cauterization of white swellings which is morphea." 
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	Here is my translation:

De cauterizacio de cranc.	On the cauterization of wounds:
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When cancer begins to develop and you wish to treat it, then use a circular cautery to burn the affected area while it is still fresh.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	The wise men say that it should be cauterized with the last cautery in its place, but I have not seen this done before as I fear it may become an ulcer; I've only witnessed this a few times.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	It is more effective to cauterize the wound in a circular motion as we've discussed before or with multiple pointed cauteries.

De cauterizacio de adubilati.	De cauterizacio de adubilati.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio. De cauterizacio de corrodent.	On the cauterization of ulcers." 
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	Here is my translation of your provided text: 
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore, if you see that corrosion in a place where the cauterization with fire is suffered, then burn several small and large cauteries as appropriate for that location where there is corrosion.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	Then proceed with the cauterization of the entire affected area while you eradicate all corrosion, leaving behind no cause for it.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	Afterwards, clean the affected area for three days and apply on the cauterized spots a poultice made of oil mixed with trisyllabic words until all scars are eradicated and any corruption is gone.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	Then cure it with flesh-building ointments.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	But after three days if you see that the flesh is born healthy and there's no corruption present, then it's good; otherwise, repeat the cauterization on what remains of the corrupted areas.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And sometimes corrosion is treated with sharp medicine as it replaces the role of cauterization.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	But nonetheless, cauterization by fire is more effective at providing assistance.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already mentioned the cure of it with sharp medicine in this section, so take that when you need it.
Capitol .liii.	Capitol .liii.: Chapter 53.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On the cauterization of wounds and other similar treatments.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Small visible marks found in the parts affected by the sick person's foot are called wounds, and they can be caused by a severe impact on the side of the foot; cauterization for such wounds is done according to two methods: hot iron cautery and chemical cautery with caustic water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	For hot iron cauterization, you must prepare the cautery tool in the shape of an eagle's claw with a curve similar to that of a pen nib, which is made from iron according to the size and quantity required for the wound being treated; it should be very fine.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	Then place that hot iron on the wound and move your hand around with the cautery tool following the outline of the wound until it reaches its full depth.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	Let it be for three days before beginning to move your arm again.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	Then plaster the affected area with a poultice of wild mallows boiled in salt, and let it stay on for one night; this will eliminate any inflammation.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with ointment made from generative flesh until it is healed.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	If they are not converted and this happens often on the surface of their body, especially on hands and feet, then you should apply cauterization with hot water to them; take a tube made from horn or iron or vulture's beak and place it over the nail; then pour into the tube a small amount of boiling water, cover your hand, and rotate that entirely by hand, pressing hard against the end of the nail, expelling the boiling water through the tip of the nail; let the patient wait for an hour to feel the bite of the boiling water, and then remove it, as the nail with its roots will have been extracted.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And likewise do this to them again until you have removed all those that are in their body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	Then treat those wounds, now that the roots of the nails have been eradicated, with ointments that help generate flesh.
Capitol .liiii.	This seems to be indicating a new chapter or section in the text; is there another excerpt for me to translate?
De cauterizacio de tremor.	On the cauterization of tremors.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When there is any trembling due to coldness in the nerves or due to a febrile condition caused by cold, or for any similar reason, you should cauterize that person with four cauteries or five on the vertebrae of their back, one between each vertebra; and with a cautery on their feet, and an olive-shaped cautery over their stomach.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And if the patient's trembling subsides and they recover quickly from their cold illness, [it is a good sign].
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 5.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On the cauterization of white (i.e., cold) accidents to the body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When white (i.e., cold) pustules or abscesses appear on the body that are made of thick and corrupted matter, then at the beginning of their appearance, they should be cauterized with a subtle cautery made from myrtle wood, whose end has been extended over fire; or with long needles; or with a lenticular (i.e., lens-shaped) cautery.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	And in some cases, a silver cautery is used at the beginning of their expulsion according to this method; they are not burned, and the superfluidity is removed by doing so, [and] they recover from it.
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	However, make sure that this is done with proper evacuation through bloodletting.
