De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	Here's my best attempt at translating this line: 
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore, when it happens to someone, then treat him with your hand at the orifice of the wound, and place your index finger over it tightly so that blood clots are stopped from flowing out through your finger, without anything coming out.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	Then place the small and large olive-shaped cauteries on the fire for a long time, in great number, and blow on them until they are well ignited.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	Then take one of those, small or large depending on the place and the extent to which the artery is broken, over that vein hastily after you have stopped your finger, and apply the cautery until it is seared and stops the flow of blood.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if blood comes out of the wound when you release your finger and remove the first cautery, then take another one that has been heated among those which were prepared on the fire, and do not stop doing this until the bleeding is staunched.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	Make sure you do not burn the nerve which is here, and that another evil does not befall the patient.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And know that when blood flows from the artery, it is not possible to stop its flow in those (cases) except by one of four methods: either with a cautery like the one mentioned before, or through extraction if it has not been extracted already, for when it is extracted and its ends are burnt, then the bleeding stops; or binding it firmly with gall or ligatures, or applying medications whose power lies in constriction; and they should be tightly bound with suitable bandages.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	Moreover, he who manages restriction by tying with a cloth or through positioning the patient near sources of heat, will only succeed in causing inflammation.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if it reaches a place where there is no doctor and medicine, then proceed by placing the index finger on the opening of that vein as we have said, and understand the great compression on him before the blood gets stuck in its main part above the wound; make sure to not bite the skin over the injury. Sprinkle cold water on it so much that the blood coagulates and thickens; then proceed with cauterization or medicine if needed.
Comensa la segonda partida.	The second part begins.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	On incision, perforation, cupping, bloodletting, wounds, and their likes.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already mentioned in the first chapter all those illnesses where cauterization by fire is appropriate and which medicine to use, as well as the occasions for it and their causes, along with necessary instruments and types of cauterizations; and I have ordered chapters from head to toe.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	Under this chapter I will proceed in the same manner so as to provide relief for the afflicted one according to his request.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before I begin this, my child, know that in this chapter we shall learn about the very same thing that was explained in the first chapter on cauterization.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And for this reason, my child, you must be extremely careful as the operation described in this chapter requires great attention to detail as it involves various procedures such as bloodletting, incision on veins, dealing with abscesses, excisions, cleansing of ulcers, removal of arrows and stones, and similar interventions.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	All these procedures are accompanied by fear, trembling, and in most cases, death itself.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	I warn you, my child, so that this hesitation does not befall upon you, as sometimes one must take on the ways of men and employ methods to treat illnesses.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	There are times when one may become afraid of their own illness and this lightens the burden that leads to death, due to how much they suffer from it, as well as the length of time since its onset, which is a sign of impending mortality.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And among those is he who gives you his wealth and says, 'Be content with this,' while your health depends on him, and his ailment is harmful.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	So you must not consent to him who comes to you in this manner; let your caution be greater than covetousness and greed; do not presume any cause over this unless there is certain knowledge that verifies it to you, and from whom you receive praiseworthy succession.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	Use in the cure of all your ailments the prognostication and indication from him who has been restored to health, for in this you will find help towards acquiring fame and remembrance, praise and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	O children, may God breathe His understanding into you, and may He not withhold guidance and protection from you, for these are in His hands.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have arranged this chapter by distinguishing its chapters as it precedes in the chapter on cauterization, from the treatment of the head to the feet, so that you may find relief for what you seek and require.
Capitol primier.	Chapter One.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the cure for water accumulation in a child's head.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this disease, which often occurs in children during childbirth, happens when the nurse forcefully pulls on the child's head.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And some cases occur for hidden reasons which are unknown.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	I have never seen this disease in anyone other than children; all those whom I saw suffered an untimely death, and thus it appears to me as a sorrowful affliction.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	I have seen a child whose head was filled with water; their head remained enlarged to such an extent that they could not lie down due to the size of their head, and as humidity increased, death came swiftly.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	This accumulation of humidity occurs either between the brain and skull or below the skull on the nape.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	When the operation is performed on that part where humidity accumulates between the brain and skull, and there is little pus, you should make an incision in the middle of the head with a latitudinal cut, which should be as long as two nuts to allow the humidity to escape. This is what we call the spatium.
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And so, if the humidity is more abundant and the abscess is larger, then there are two incisions made in this manner:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the humidity is beneath the bones, this will be indicated by the hair on your head being parted and wet when you compress that area with your hand internally; it is not hidden from you.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	Make three incisions on the top of your head in this manner:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	Then extract all the humidity from the incision; after this, bind the incisions with linen and feathers; then on the fifth day, pour vinegar and oil over it; next unbind the binding and cure the wound with ointment and balm, binding his head again in equal measure; and feed the patient dry food of little moisture until the member is comforted and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	There is another method of incision that considers the magnitude of the abscess and the collection of water, as some patients have more in their occipital region, or in front, on the right side, or on the left; therefore, pay attention to where the abscess appears and the accumulation of water, then proceed with the incision accordingly.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	Certainly! Here is my translation of the provided text into English, line by line:
Capitol .ii.	Capitol .ii.: Here we begin chapter two. 
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	When it comes to incising the arteries located behind the ears, they are referred to as "hilasseysse.
Capitol segon.	Chapter 2.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When an old cataract or wound on the eyes or feet does not respond to medicinal treatment, the final cure in such cases is the incision of those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And therefore, when you wish to incise those arteries while the patient is shaving their head, rub the area with rough cloth so that the veins appear, then have the patient's neck tightly wrapped in a cloth; consider where the pulse of the vein can be felt; these places, which are above the areas behind the ears, may not always be obvious.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	Then cover the vein with a cloth and incise each one using a sharp spatula coming from either side until you reach the bone, this will be across the breadth of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you wish, insert the spatula under the artery and transect it at the incision made above.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	Let the length of the incision be about two fingers in size because when any vein is incised blood is emitted with a pulsating ejection, leaping out with frequent bounds.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os. 
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	Here is the translated text: 
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	Under consideration is a plague where some cause of death remains in the bone, then cut away that portion before it turns into an abscess.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Then strengthen the wound with feathers and soft cloth bandages, and treat it with ointments until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter 3.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	On the extraction of arrows that are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When someone experiences an ancient migraine or severe headaches due to moist and windy conditions in the hollows of their temples, or it is an old and similar condition that does not respond to medicinal treatments, we resort to extracting arrows from the temples, or cauterizing them as we have demonstrated.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	The procedure for the operation and extraction of arrows is as follows: The patient shaves the hair from their temples; then locate the arrowhead, which is visible in the temple area, unless it is obscured by swelling due to the violent impact.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	If it is obscured from view, then have the patient's neck secured with a piece of cloth; then rub the area with a rough cloth or soak it with warm water until the arrowhead becomes visibly apparent.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then you take the spatula which has this shape:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	Then you remove the thread with ease until you reach the arrow; then pull it out gently and extract the arrowhead from the upper parts, uncovering it from the layers of clothing underneath.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	However, if the artery is delicate, you wrap it with the end of the ointment, and then cut off a portion based on the length of its extremities and how contracted they are, ensuring there is no blood flow, as without cutting them properly, the blood will not stop flowing.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	Then evacuate some of the patient's blood, about one to three ounces.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the wound is large, make sure to stitch it closed in two places with strong double thread or cords, and avoid cutting any putrefied flesh before the wound has healed, as this could cause blood flow.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	Then cut away any superfluous flesh that is between the two bindings, doing so either now or at another time.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you wish, cauterize it with a cautery or use a cautery knife to cauterize the extremities after they have been cut, and this will serve the same purpose.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	It is better if the patient has a fever or has a warm complexion; because cauterization is one of those remedies that helps to dry out the excess humidity in the body, and therefore it is more beneficial.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	Then it is necessary to extract the arrows that are stuck in the wound and clean the area thoroughly with decently prepared powder; then treat it with dry medicines to promote healing and prevent infection.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if while treating the wound there is an unexpected flow of blood from the arrow's entry point, then you should quickly try to stem the bleeding by either using cauterization or packing the area with a cloth; apply pressure with your hand until the bleeding stops.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if none of the above methods are available to you, then place your finger on the wound to let the blood clot; rinse the area with very cold water until it numbs and becomes insensitive, and apply pressure as needed.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	The easiest way to extract an arrow is to cauterize the vein with this special two-pronged cautery; mark both sides of the wound with a thread and then place several ignited pieces of wood on top until they come into contact with the bone, burning through it in two places. This will sever the vein between its extremities as they are not fully consolidated yet by the cauterization.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the shape of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	Both edges should be sharp.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	However, if it has less sharpness than two edges, as it is sharp like two edges close to each part, and does not cut the flesh quickly.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore, in those with some fatness, the heat of the fire is to be held back from them and the flesh should be cut lightly.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this work is better than any other and lighter as well.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	The space between the two edges should be equal to the thickness of your finger.
Capitol quart.	It seems that this text is divided into different sections or chapters, as indicated by "Capitol quart" which likely means Chapter 4. Would you like me to continue translating the next section?
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	On the treatment of acute and acidic sores on the heels.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When it is an acidic sore, and the affected area is on those veins that are above the crown of the head outwards, and you find no cause for its cure through medicine, and sometimes the face of the patient turns red and feels as if ants were crawling on their forehead, and the heels themselves become shrunken, moist so much that even their skin becomes noticeable, and the eyelids are scraped by the acidity of the tears, then the old remedy for this operation is now abandoned.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And you command the patient to scratch their hairline, then make three equally spaced incisions in their forehead according to its length.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	If the length of each incision is about two fingers: one incision should be equally distant to the length of the nose in the middle of the forehead; another according to the length of a small move by the corners of the eyes that are near the tear duct, and the third from there on.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	Be careful not to cut the arches that are on both sides, and extend your hand from the continuation of both jaws.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	If the space between each incision is about three fingers wide...
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a piece of sponge equipped with many dry cloths to absorb the blood...
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	Then insert the spatula of double-pointed ends into this, which has the shape of the incision...
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	...that goes from one temple to the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Cut out all of the tissue between the two incisions down to the bone with a chisel and then make this incision from the middle one to the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	Then place this on the same space and insert another tool into the first incision, it is called a 'cutella', sharp on one side but not on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	Place the edge of this sharp side towards the attached flesh and its other edge between the bone and soft tissue; use it to reach the median sulcus, and with it sever all vessels that descend from the brain to the hips.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	Let the incision be continued along that which appears of soft tissue, then do this within the median cleft up to another cleft.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And since there is an equal quantity of blood flowing, squeeze the places where clotted blood has formed.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	Then place on each cleft a sufficient amount of old lint, and over these apply some powder moistened with wine and oil or vinegar, ensuring it does not become infected.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	On the third day, remove all bindings and administer a large flush of warm water or decoction, then treat it with some unguent made from rose oil and others until the wounds are healed.
Capitol .v.	Capitol .v. 
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	Of the cure for tears using purgatives and other descending remedies from within the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When someone experiences continuous and sharp purgatives, and the patient's eyes become weak and small, with their eyelids ulcerated and losing hair, accompanied by a severe headache and extreme exhaustion, then one should know that these symptoms indicate that the purgative substances originate from the sensitive veins within the cranial cavity.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best treatment for such cases is this: instruct the patient to press their forehead, and then make a small incision at the center of the forehead, running laterally from the left temple to the right one (starting from the left temple suture and ending at the right), ensuring it penetrates the bone; extend your hand towards the lateral ligaments of the temples which are involved in mastication. Once the bone is exposed,
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry all the blood with a sponge or a dry cloth, and then fill the space between the two lips of the incision with old cotton wool or linen cloths.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	Then press down on it with powder mixed with vinegar and oil, to prevent the development of an enclosed abscess.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
Capitol .vi.	Capitol .vi.: Chapter 6. 
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	From curing what falls into the ears." 
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	Certainly! Here is my translation of the given sentence: 
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then place some pieces of cloth or wool in the ear canal, and gently stretch out the ear flaps (pinna), as these conditions are often forgotten due to such causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not retracted (i.e., the pinna), then use an instrument called a 'gesti epicicarios' for extraction, which has this form:" [Here, a description or illustration of the instrument would be provided.]
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	If it cannot be extracted with the 'gesti', then proceed to use a thin hook with minimal curvature for extraction.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And if that fails, make a small metal cannula and insert the tip into the ear canal, sealing around it with wax and softened oil to ensure only the cannula is exposed.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	Then extract it with strong suction (e.g., using your mouth), as such cases have been described earlier.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if it is still not extracted, take a bright silver coin or a similar metal object that has been used to capture birds (e.g., with a small amount of fat), place it on the end of a rod, and then wrap this assembly in cloth appropriately.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then gently insert [the medicated substance] into the canal of the ear, and remove moisture from the ear.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And so if none of these causes are forgotten [and considered], then you proceed to cut away that which has become an abscess or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	The way of cutting away [the abscess or spasm] is to first bleed the patient from the cephalic vein and extract blood according to their virtue, then make that area stop bleeding between your hands, turning the ear toward the parted areas above it; ending with a small slit at the root of the ear below what was pressed by your grasp.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And if the slit is of lunar shape and reaches bone, then you chisel away that bone once it has turned [black], using appropriate instruments; subsequently sew up the slit quickly, curing it until it heals.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause falls in the ear as one of those greasy things that grow and become inflamed, then administer to its cure and extraction; but if it does not obey your efforts at this [extraction], then you take thin soft wax shaped like so:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	And administer to him the excision of that grain which has fallen into the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not do this when you think that it has already been moistened by the vapor of the ear; instead, break it into small pieces and then extract them with your fingernails or with gentle gestures, or through incision as we have said, for its extraction is alleviated.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	Moreover, when water has entered the ear, causing the patient to sneeze at first, fill their ear with some old cotton, and wipe that ear in which there is water; if it is still forgotten, then good; otherwise, take thin sticks of juniper or pine according to the length of your finger, heat them a little over the fire, and the patient should insert one of those into the hole of their ear and jump on one foot from that side and hit with a stone against the stick which is inside the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Therefore, do not stop this until all the water has been removed.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc i, e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And once the water has been removed in such a way that you take a piece of paper or cloth and place one end inside the ear while extending its other end over the fire until it is burned for the most part.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And place another sponge and do this multiple times until all the water is expelled, then remove that with a cannula as previously mentioned about extracting stones.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	When extracting a foreign object that has entered through the ear canal, if it is a small object, push it further in and remove it as we mentioned earlier regarding dividing objects; but if it is a large object causing an abscess in the ear, then manage its extraction with twists and turns, and this cause is less severe than other causes leading to ear problems.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	In the extraction of worms born in the ear, when you treat it with what we mentioned earlier in the division and in the treatise on distillations, and if your treatment does not work, then you must observe the ear in the sunlight.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And so, if any cause of the worms appears here, then extract them with subtle twists or turns; but if no cause is apparent, take a cannula and place a narrow end inside while keeping the wide end outside, this being the shape of it:" (likely referring to drawing out the worm)
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	Insert the narrow end into the ear according to the extent that the patient can endure; then apply a strong suction with your mouth and do this multiple times until all the worms are expelled.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And for your effusion, in which you pour medicinal oils into the ear with this instrument, here is its form:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	Make it from silver or brass, narrow, with a small hole in the middle, and flat on top.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And it should be as long as what fits in the cavity of the channel that contains it, according to what is necessary.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	If you wish, take the rod and wrap wax around its end appropriately, then pour oil into the cavity of the implement or juice from some herb, or whatever medicine from these that you want in the channel - which is inside the ear -, and then insert the rod with the wax at its top and squeeze it gently with your hand until the oil is expelled into the cavity and the patient feels the oil within.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	What goes in the ear should be lightly scorched with fire beforehand.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	Make sure the cause you are dripping into the ear is not too cold, as these ear medicines cannot withstand that.
Capitol .vii.	It seems this text ends with Chapter 7 indicated by "Capitol .vii.". Would you like me to translate any other part of the text?
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas." 
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Here is my translation of the text: 
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in the one where you have successfully completed the procedure, it is necessary that you place the patient's ear towards the sun and look into it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And so if you see any swelling present, open it with a thin spatula which has this shape:" (At this point the author may have inserted an illustration.)
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the end of it is small in width, with one side sharp and the other not, and the spatula has two longitudinal edges to avoid causing harm to the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And if the swelling is due to flesh growing in the ear or its canal, then take some thin scissors and cut it open vigorously until all the flesh is exposed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	If the swelling is in the rim of the ear, then take a thin and pointed rod and warm it over fire slightly, and then insert this into the canal of the ear.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And so if you have detected the swelling with something that the patient hears easily due to its weight, apply pressure to it with ease; and be careful not to touch the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Under the ear, place a bandage of the second type with an amount equal to the width of the wound you have covered in Egyptian ointment. Do this for several days until you are sure the wound is healing well or take some cotton and immerse it in water then sprinkle on it finely ground starch and use that; but if you see that your ear has become gangrenous, then dig out the pus and replace with another type of poultice made from cerate oil while gently pressing upon the abscess until it bursts. And finally, cure him so that he is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	If there is bleeding, then quickly soak the dressing or bandage in cold water and place it on the ear; use another cure that will stem the blood flow described in the 'treatise of distillation.'
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8:
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	The cure for the infection that occurs on the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Infections of the eyelids that sometimes become moist and at other times are dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Thus, you should have those infections at the sides of your face or ears and divide them with a spatula into their roots; then place them finely ground on the affected areas.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if pain from a blood flux occurs, then you cauterize those areas with a subtle lancet-like cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization method is when those incisions and punctures are carefully returned to their original position after removing any cause of their occurrence; and when they are cauterized with fire, those roots or causes are burned away and will not return.
Capitol .ix.	It seems you have provided another section from the medieval medical treatise, which I am happy to translate for you: 
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Cure for the great swelling that occurs in the eyelids of children.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	When small specks are found on the eyelids of children due to some cause resembling great strength and hardness, it is therefore called a 'great swelling'.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And this is an accumulation of dense moisture above and below the eyelid.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the operation for them is as follows: if the swelling is not limited to the eyelid but extends to other parts of their body and it is soft everywhere; and its cause is considered light.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Make an incision across its width and then remove it from all sides with ease, lifting it up and cutting it off.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you do not have the equipment for its incision and instead must penetrate the eyelid with a small incision, then it will cause no damage.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the shape is large, you adjust it with stitches; treat it until it heals.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, you will not suffer any harm from it as its ointment restores it and promotes healing.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	Here is my attempt at translating the provided text: 
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And then proceed with the incision, wash the wound with salty water; and treat the area with ointment until it heals.
Capitol .x.	Here is my best attempt at translating the text: 
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Axcirnath is a serious condition caused by growths in the eyelids' lining, mainly affecting children, which strains their eyes and leads to frequent coughing fits; they cannot withstand sunlight because of this, as tears stream down their faces.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And so you should make them wear glasses over their eyes all the time, and when they sleep as well; keep their eyelids moist under the eyebrows, which are already covered in inflammation, and there is an apparent threat of a burst vessel in the eye; also, whenever you press the area with your fingers, you can feel a pulsation within.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	A surgical method involves having the patient rest their head on your lap and covering them with a cloth, then drawing a circle around it proportional to the size of an artichoke leaf, pressing down all along its circumference so that blood accumulates in the middle, and finally making an incision at the centre of this moist spot using a lancet to slice open the skin but not too deeply, similar to what is done during phlebotomy.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	You must open the vein completely until you reach the vessel, as in its deepest parts there is always a clot according to the whiteness of the incision's shape.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Donc extratz aquella am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And be careful not to tighten in the wound, lest you touch the bone with the spatula and worsen his condition.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	However, if your artery does not appear at the beginning of the wound, but you find a small one near it that is easily accessible, then proceed to extract it as we have previously mentioned; and then soak some cloth in water and vinegar and place them on the affected area, pressing down firmly.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And ensure that you do not place any salt there, lest it worsen the moisture within the wound.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then treat him until he is healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	However, if an infected ulcer occurs in the area, treat it with frequent poultices until it is healed.
Capitol .xi.	It seems you have provided another excerpt from this medieval medical treatise. Please provide me with the text and I will translate it for you.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	On the methods of handling bones.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When hairs grow on the eyelids due to old age or because they have been burnt, causing discomfort to the eyes and leading to excessive tears, soft eyelids, and even destruction of the eye, which is called 'tactinir del huel' (I assume this means 'eye inflammation'), it can be treated in four ways: by cauterization with fire; by using sharp medicine as mentioned earlier in the chapter on cautery; by performing an incision and suturing to remove the hairs; or through the use of cannulas, which I will explain further.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	Here is my attempt at translating the provided text:
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	Certainly! Here is the translation of your source sentence:
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	May it be that the shape is determined by the amount of elevation of the eyelid, for this already varies among people, as there are those who require a large incision on their eyelids according to the quantity needed to soften the eyelid.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	Then make an incision along the two lines you have marked, starting from the larger tear duct towards the smaller one.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your incision near the natural hairs is as wide as your thumb.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	Then place the onion at one of the two ends of the suture, and then remove its outer layer completely. Adjust the stitching to tighten both lips with thread or fine woolen yarn, wipe away any blood, and use a few pieces of adhesive plaster over the eyebrows with some glue if you wish to do so, but it is not necessary.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	Then remove the thread suture within three or four days and take care of it.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	If you wish, leave the plaster without a suture and treat it with drying and contracting agents, as the eyelid is elevated due to the sealing of the plaster and its adhesion; however, stitching is better, and so say the ancient physicians.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	But still, there is concern for the patient's condition, and it is a good course of action, without causing any fear in him.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	Another method of examination is to look for the presence of something like a myrtle leaf shape on the eyelid. Then lift the eyelid with three separate but grouped hooks following this formation:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	If obtaining the hooks is not feasible and this is not considered harmful, take a needle with thread, place it in the middle of the aforementioned figure, pass one end through the larger lacrimal, the other near the smaller lacrimal, adjust both threads equally between your fingers, then use these to lift your hand at an equal height, lifting the entire chain as described above.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then adjust the two lips of the wound with stitches, treat what is inside until it heals.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	But if an abscess occurs due to your incision or tear, you should drain that abscess with wax and similar materials, and use ointments.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And sometimes, on the eyelid, its hairs turn inward, in which case you must use what we have already mentioned regarding incision; however, stitching is more artificial in any case.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	And it is necessary that you turn the eyelid and split the figure within as I have described; then, by art, make two thin tubes or sticks whose length matches the length of the eyelid, and their width should be less than the width of your thumb.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already split the ends of each part where you have inserted the threads.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	Then add each thin thread over the superfluous parts of the eyelid and constrict the tubes from both sides with a strong force; leave it like this for some days, because the nerves will die due to the constriction and will be denied blood circulation so that they may fall off by themselves.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	But if it takes too long, then break it with tweezers; afterwards cure the wound until it is healed.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	Once it has solidified, the eyelid will be raised, and the hairs won't stick out.
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is how you will make two tubes according to the above-mentioned method:
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	The length and width must not be more or less than the required amount.

De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	When raising the hairy skin with a needle when it is hard.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When the hairs are unnatural, hard, rough and prickly on the scalp, then the operation for it is that you take a fine needle and place it in some soft cedar or lion's fat, and then adjust its ends very carefully.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And let the length of the threads be in quantity as much as one palm [length].
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	Then compose another soft thread underneath it shortly, and twist the ends of that if you wish.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	Then have the patient put their head in your lap, and be close to the sunlight so that your work is clear, for it is a delicate and fine operation.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	Then introduce the needle into the root of the adjusted hair that requires ingenuity, and make it penetrate the eyelid quickly while you extract it from the natural hair.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	Then pull the hair out from above and place it in a safe place; let there be one or two or three hairs, but not more.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And then draw your hand towards that place where the hair has grown out of the eyelid with something foreign in it along with the natural hair.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if you pull out the foreign object and the hair is not pulled along with it, then extract the foreign body from its surroundings using the needle that you have prepared for this purpose until you do manage to remove the said foreign object.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And then cover that area with a plaster (bandage) after you have removed the foreign object and extracted it using the needle; press hard on the eye when doing so until all its contents are released, and leave the eye closed for two or three days while the hair re-grows in the natural place of origin.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	If the hair is shorter, then you should take a long artificial hair and attach it to one of the natural hairs; elevate this (the foreign object), or leave it where it is until it grows out over time before removing it.

De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	Regarding the treatment of a boil that appears on the eyelid." 
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When there is swelling in the eyelid and it becomes contracted, either on the right or left side, due to poor consolidation of a wound, incision, or cauterization, this condition is called "leporina." This type of eyelid contraction can be natural or accidental, arising from poor healing of wounds, incisions, or cauterizations, or resembling these conditions.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	The method of performing the operation on the patient is as follows: make an incision in that area where there was poor consolidation, separate the edges or lips of the wound, place a piece of linen cloth between them, and secure it until they heal together.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	It is not advisable to use treatments that dry out or constrict the wound, as this can cause a relapse of the swelling and make it worse than before.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Apply to the affected area remedies that have a softening effect, such as fenugreek. Prepare a mixture by soaking marshmallow root and flax seeds in water, or use a softened unguent called "diaphlegmatic," which can be liquefied with any oil. Immerse the cloth in this preparation and use it for treatment.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	The key to your successful treatment is to ensure that you perforate any unhealed areas, following the original shape or form of the wound at its onset.
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation which we have mentioned is nothing but a slight correction of the helicexachrati (possibly referring to a type of surgical procedure), which does not restore the shape of the place as described before.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14:
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	On the treatment of helicexachrati, which is performed on the eyelid below.
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This type of helicexachrati surgery performed on the lower eyelid is properly called "alxacrati"; it can be either naturally occurring or caused by an accident.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	Accidental cases may occur due to trauma, such as a blow or cut, by using a cauterizing tool, or through similar means.
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	The procedure for this operation is as follows: take a needle with double thread and insert it into the flesh, passing it from the left tear duct to the right one, ensuring that the thread reaches both ends of the flesh.
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	Then stretch out the flesh at both ends away from the needle and sew it with the needle, making wide incisions.
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	And so the eyelid will return to its original shape if it is suitable; otherwise, take a blade and place it in the split form, using it to turn the eyelid back, creating two fissures on the side of the lower eyelid.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	E aquesta figura es letra grega: la landa.
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	And then remove that amount of flesh which is as wide as his thumb beneath him; this corresponds to the eyelid.
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	Then, adjust the separated parts and sew them with woolen thread; after that, apply the softening medications and poultices we mentioned earlier until they are healed.
E si alxacrati endeve per fissura o sutura o cauteri, lahoras cove que tu fendas am fissura plana sobre les pels de la palpebra segon que es precedit.	If you have to cut there by incision or suture with a cauterizing iron, then make an even and smooth incision on the skin of the eyelid as described before.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	Then separate the poultice between the two lips, as we have mentioned earlier.
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In the conclusion of this treatise on curing wounds, whether they are above or below the operation site, their treatment is arranged according to the manner in which they heal and these can be diverse.
E le artifexs savi totz temps prepara engen en quascuna manieyra la qual es possibla a lu entro que fassa retornar la figura a la forma natural, o prop de aquela, e aquel malaute segon que a lu conveneys de la operacio e dels strumentz en las majors disposicios.	And the skilled practitioner always devises means by which he can restore the injured body to its natural shape or something close to it and this malady requires an operation with appropriate instruments under optimal conditions.
Capitol .xv.	The number fifteen, indicating that this is the fifteenth chapter of the treatise.
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	Of the adherence of the eyelid to the conjunctiva or to the cornea.
Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	When this consolidation occurs in many men, so that the eyelid is stuck to the white of the eye and is prohibited from easily moving and performing its natural functions, it is necessary for you to insert the tip of a needle under the eyelid and lift it up or extend it with your thumb.
E aprop tu inscideys la adherencia am spatum subtil, le qual no sia am acuitat de las inscisios, habantz obtus un petit per so que·l malaute no sia inquietat deves la operacio, e remau le spatum que no ledesca le huel am la sua acuitat.	Then you should cut the adherence with a fine spatula, which should not be too sharp to avoid any incisions, being slightly blunt so as not to disturb the patient during the operation, and handle the spatula carefully to prevent it from damaging the eye with its sharpness.
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	And your incision should result in the excision of that adherence with ease, allowing for the return of the eyelid to its natural shape and healing all the adhesion.
E aprop tu met en le huel aygua salada am la qual tu laves; o distilla en lu de zunia dissolvut en l’aygua.	Then, you should put some saltwater into the eye to wash it or distill into it some zinc dissolved in water.
E aprop separa entre la palpebra e l’huel am calgua de li, e pausa sobre le huel lana infuza en album de huou, e aprop le tertz jorn usa de causas consolidativas entro que sia sanat.	Then separate between the eyelid and the eye with lint, place on the eye wool infused in egg white, and after three days use some consolidating substances until it is healed.

De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu. E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	Under both species (of this disease) it does not begin except from the greater lacrimal, where it goes little by little covering the sight and prohibiting light and eye movement.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en la inscizio de lu es que·l malaute pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop obre les huels de lu, e eleva la palpebra am la tua ma, e aprop colligeys la ungla am onci de pauca duplicacio e exten aquela a las partidas desus.	The way to proceed with the incision is for the patient to lean their head onto your lap, then open their eyes and lift the eyelid with your hand. Take a fingernail with a piece of cloth and extend it to cover the upper part.
E aprop pren una agula e entromet en aquela un pel de cavalh o de buou o de vaqua, o de semblantz, o de fiel fort, o duplica la extremitat de la agulha petit a petit e fica aquela en le mieg de la ungla, e penetra aquela am la agulha, e lia am fiel la ungla; e exten aquela a las partidas desus, e excorja am le pel le latz de la ungla lo qual siec la pupilla. E ayssi tu sieguas aquela am le pel entro al derier de lu.	And so you would cut it with the hair behind him/her.
E aprop tu inscideys le romanent en la razitz del lacrimal am spatum subtil o am petitas forfexs, e leysa la carn del lacrimal natural per so que per inscizio de aquela no endevengua fluxs de lagremas continuabla.
