E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And when you have completed that step, make the needle pass again on this same side from outside to inside; leave the tip of the suture here and then pierce the other end with the needle from inside to outside.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And use your instrument for penetration, with which you will penetrate the hip joint at the end of the femur where it is attached to him so that everything penetrates.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	Then start from this side, and stitch that end of the hip joint on the other side, remove the needle from the suture which has penetrated, then reduce it in that suture and sew the end of the hip joint that is on the other side with this end of the femur; remove that one from the suture which is on his part.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	Do this once and then again, and do this another time so that you sew everything that is outside according to that example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	The summary of this method of suturing is that you sew with a stitch of small stitches with which the hair is sewn, so that you suture the hip joint once from the side of the end of the suture, and then again until it is completed.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	Moreover, the second type of specific suture which is called by name Guillain's and this concerns him and for his dissection, it is that you sew this according to semi-suture with which some physicians suture it, so that they bring together every part to its corresponding part on him appropriately by nature; and apply one end of the other to him and the end of the femur to the other end of him, and this is done as I explain to you.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	Make sure you keep the needle at the tip of your closest eye, make it penetrate from outside to inside that sole, and let both ends of the suture pass through; then turn the needle around and make it penetrate from outside inwards on both sides of the suture.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	Then turn each one of them and make it penetrate from inside out on the other side of the sole at both ends, that is on the opposite side.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this way of suturing is better than the common light suturing method, which I have previously mentioned.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the speech of Wally.
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	Some people call this the abdominal suturing method, which is done with two needles in which you insert a thread through each one of them; and as for what needs to be done by you, start by making the needle penetrate from where it came out on the other side, following the same way that I suture skins.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And bear in mind that when the incision is right in the middle of the abdomen it becomes more difficult to suture than on other areas.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	Moreover, the treatment of plague is similar to that of other diseases.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	Which is caused by the fact that when you acquire a fresh plague with their blood before it affects the air, reduce the intestine and cook it and sew it properly, then place on it some incarnative powder.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if the air has already affected the plague, then place on it some hot embers which are in your presence until they become hard and coagulate the bile, and let them be consolidated there for a while; then treat it like other diseases until it is healed.
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	But if you do not have the medicines at hand, then place on it something else, because it begins to shake its arms and legs violently, an old one with a broken leg, and change that twice a day, as you were taught, until it is healed, for you would need no other medicine in most cases when dealing with simple plagues.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	However, if you fear that the plague may spread to vital organs, ensure that you immerse a lion's skin in high-quality olive oil or rose oil, and place it around the area between the armpits and leave them there.
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	If the patient feels pain or putrefaction in their intestines, as this often happens, then you should apply black stiptic wine to crystallize it, especially if the gangrene has reached the intestine and is being forced inside his cavity.
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	Know that an inflammation of the large intestine is more easily healed than one in the small intestines.
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	And it is difficult to heal when the intestine called "gegunu" does not receive any cure for its plague; this happens because of the great number of veins in it and their size, as well as the thinness of the gut's body and how close they are to the nervous system.
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	However, if what proceeds from the plague is a hernia, and it's fresh, reduce that according to your recipe for reducing intestines similarly.
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	But if it has crossed to the other side and already turned green or black, then you should open that with a lancet on the place where it's darkened, so blood flows out of it, as there are veins and arteries in the hernia.
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	Here is my attempt at translating each line into English:

E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	It is possible to tie the wound with a fine thread made from the intestine of an animal, as it can be passed through a needle; take the end of these threads of intestine and ensure they are well-trimmed, then tie one end of them together using another piece of thread, enclose this, and then insert that thread into the needles and sew up the wound with them, reducing its size.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	This method of suture using ants is not only a matter of faith but also hope.

De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	On the treatment of ulcers and fistulas.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	And it is moist in some men, which leads to swelling; and often this moisture is absorbed within a few hours.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	Sometimes this moisture becomes solid, and it is small in amount, thick in substance, but light.
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	And I have said before in the division that when I speak of wounds (or ulcers), any wound or ulcer which neither heals nor appears on bare flesh is not such a thing but one of these causes: either due to lack of blood in the body; or because it is malignant; or because there is hard flesh between it and the lips, hindering new flesh from forming; or because it has thick discharge; or when the wound itself decays and the matter within becomes bad quality; or because the medicine is unsuitable for its cure; or if corruption comes to the region and there is pestilence; or due to the nature of the place (as in Zaragoza), where diseases are difficult to digest, and the healing of abscesses is slow by nature; or when there is one or many bones within it.
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	I have already shown all those causes, their symptoms, and the cure for them with medicines in the division (or book).
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	And now I will inform you of the treatment for a fistula, which is done through manual operation.
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	Know that fistulas can occur in any part of the body; they may affect large veins and arteries, nerves, the liver, intestines, bladder, ribs, vertebrae, or composite joints such as those found in hands and feet, and also those that are close to major organs.
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	Therefore, these types of fistulas are among the diseases that are difficult to cure and do not respond well to treatment; managing them is a tedious task fraught with challenges.
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	If there is any fistula that does not affect these specific areas and you have hope for its cure, or wish to gain insight into it, then take a piece of brass or iron; if the fistula follows a straight path, insert this instrument.
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	However, if the fistula has a curved path, then use a flexible lead instrument; as its own weight is light and can be bent to navigate through twists.
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	And if the fistula has very bad symptoms (motz horrificis), it is not possible for you [the doctor] to operate on them.
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	Close the fistula's opening by its openings (orrifici), because the moisture that comes out of it will harm other parts and spread.
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	Then examine very carefully to determine whether there are nerves involved or not, and if the fistula's cavity is shallow or deep, and it has a lot of pus coming out (motz orrificis). You must do this with all your strength, using thorough questioning, explaining to the patient what you're doing. And as for understanding the cause of pain via touch [palpitation], and other signs like those in abscesses, proceed similarly.
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	And once you have thoroughly examined all these signs, proceed to the treatment accordingly: consider whether it is a fistula that is close and superficial or in a salt location, far from joints, nerves, arteries, veins, or any of the other locations I've mentioned.
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then dry up the fistula as described before, removing whatever is in that cavity and made of corrupted flesh, anything born inside the opening of the flesh, hair or similar, and cure it until completely healed.
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	Here is the translation of your first source sentence: 
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	And do this with some ointments so that the acute medicine corrodes all that is rotten in the cavity of the fistula's corruption.
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	Then restore it with fire, which generates healthy flesh so that it may be healed.
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	But if it is not healed by this method, then you cauterize as we have explained.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	However, if the cause of the fistula is bone and you must ascertain this fact, then inspect it and dry it as we have explained, provided that you do not obstruct any vein or nerve or main limb as we have said.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is exposed and there is any corruption or blackening in it, then you remove that part until all corruption is hosted; and then treat it with something that encourages flesh so that it may be healed.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it is not healed and discharges again as before, then know that you have not achieved the complete eradication of corruption; therefore, uncover it a second time and carefully perform its resection and cleansing with your last thin probe, and then restore it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And so if he is cured, it's good; but if not, then know that the corruption has reached the distant depths of his body, which cannot be reached, and therefore you must do nothing but let it go.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the corrupted bone is small or it's accessible to you, then remove it with subtle forceps suitable for this purpose.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if multiple bones are affected, carefully extract all of them and don't leave any cause for your strength to suffer.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if any hindrance occurs due to the moisture and there is neither fear nor mistake in your incision, then incise those ligaments or flesh that are nearby, and deliver the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if you have no means to roast the bones at this time, place on the wound something that will cause it to dry up, and leave it there until it is close to those bones of flesh and ligaments, ensuring the wound is not consolidated but instead constricted in the section you have incised during your operation.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	Later, if you fear for the patient's condition, place over them a poultice made of bread soaked in oil, or a poultice of Egyptian ointment, or one of the green salves, for when those ligaments dry out and the bones are separated from it, the extraction is alleviated.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquella am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquella negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	But if the part that is corrupted in him is a large portion, and the corruption has reached the marrow of the bone, then it becomes necessary to amputate that part completely, cut open the place where the corruption has occurred, and then treat what remains so that healing can occur.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	I recommend that you bring in another man to assist you, placing him on the patient's thigh as an example and aid for your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	It is of a young man in his thirties who suffers pain in his thigh; the affected part within is close to the body's core where matter has spread to the thigh; this matter is an abscess and a large one at that; there is no external cause.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And so the time was extended due to the mistake of the doctors as the abscess grew, and he lost a lot of matter; his recovery was delayed because his leg became fistulated, and there were many orifices on him from which pus and bodily fluids would flow.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	Many doctors treated him for almost two years without success or skill; it was then that I was called upon.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And I saw his leg and the matter that ran from him through those holes in great quantity; and already the body of that man was completely debilitated, and his colour was yellow.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	Then I inserted the tube into one of those holes, and it reached his bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	And then I examined all the holes thoroughly, and found that they came from different parts of his leg.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	Then I cut and dissected over one of the holes through which I uncovered part of his bone, and found it corrupted, already earthy, rotten, and blackened; and part of the leg was already corrupted where the corruption had entered into the marrow.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	Then I cauterised what was uncovered and prepared from the bone that was exposed.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I believed that it was not in the bone but rather this corruption which I had cut away and cauterised, having already removed it.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	Then I applied the restorative process to the wound with consolidating medicines for a long time, but it was not consolidated.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then I re-opened and uncovered the wound for the second time over the first opening, and found continuous corruption of the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	I secured what appeared to be the end of that corruption, and then I was forced to perforate for his treatment and healing, but it is not healed.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And so I uncovered him once more and did not cease to carefully scrape away the bone bit by bit and perforate for his treatment, but it is not healed until I incise around a palm's width of it, extracting its marrow. Then I restored that area with medicines, and it was consolidated lightly and healed.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	No further operation or excision is necessary for him except due to the condition of his flesh and because of the limited endurance of his strength and his fear of death, as he faints at all hours from excessive evacuation.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	Therefore, he is fully healed and there remains nothing in place of the hard bone; his flesh has been well-arranged within his body, and his strength has returned to him; he is restored to his natural condition and does not do anything contrary while walking or cause any harm.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And place a stick or board underneath the bone appropriately, for when you do this it is not forbidden to saw off the corrupted flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	Cover the sawing area over the corrupted site slowly, because if it is inside the bone cavity and does not appear on its surface to our senses, then force another incision.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is corrupted but not prominent and one piece continues with another, or corruption is in its middle part or at its edge, then you must cut away all flesh from every side; place a stick underneath it as well, and saw off the first section where the corruption lies before continuing to serrate through the other section.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	The sawing should be small depending on where corruption lies as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if corruption is in the joint, then cut away that corrupted joint and saw through the bone at its continuation to another section.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if corruption is in the continuation of two joints but not on them, then this is rational rather than natural.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the chest of the hand or foot, it is most difficult; yet you must inquire into how the corruption appears to you and remove it as best you can without causing damage to veins or nerves.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquella opperacio.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	Here is my best translation of the provided text: 
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And I shall now list for you, at the end of this chapter, the number of instruments that you will use with simple substances and with which you will proceed to your prohibition, which you will experience on others.
Forma de serra:	Serra saw form:
Forma de autra serra:	Form of another saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Form of yet another saw.
Forma de autra serra gran:	Form of large saw:
Forma de ray:	Form of chisel:
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	Let the head of this chisel be like the shape of a star key, and its points follow the form of awl tips.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it is not necessary that with this [tool] the joint heads be rubbed when they are corrupted, or it has a large wide mouth.
Forma de razori major dels autres:	Form of the largest razor among others:
Forma de razori menor:	Form of smaller razor:
Forma de razori lat:	Form of wide razor:
Forma de serra autra decentment fayta: sia fayt arc de lu pus sobira e la acuitat de lu de ferr, e le membre de lu de boys punhal descentment fayt.	Form of another well-made saw: make its upper arch and sharpness out of iron, and its wooden handle should be appropriately crafted.
Forma de lu:	The way he lies down:
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	Position for when there is a hernia that has formed in the hollow of the groin area.
Forma de razori autra subtil:	Another more delicate position for a hernia:
Forma de autra razori de curvada extremitat:	Position of another hernia, which is on the curved part of the side:
Forma de rasori petit semblant a tenta:	Position for a small hernia resembling a tent:
Forma de incisori am le qual so inscidit les osses:	Position of the incision, which has been cut into the bones:
Forma de inscisori autra minor:	Another position for an incision that is less severe or smaller in size.
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	The position of another incision, resembling a crack with its end being like a saw and appearing in many places along the bones:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	The position of the crack, which corresponds to where there is a hole in the bones:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its end is triangular with sharp points.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian iron, covering all the causes that we have mentioned regarding cracks and incisions.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	De inscizio extremitatz translates to "On the incision of the limbs," and de la serratura dels osses means "and the locking of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura quella ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And in a similar manner, if it is due to the impact of certain poisonous causes such as those from the scorpion of the sea or the viper or the adder and others like them.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or impact is at the tip of the finger, then you must make an incision in the finger and not allow any space for the corruption to spread into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	Similarly, if it reaches the hand, you must make an incision at the base of the forearm and prevent any space for corruption to reach the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if instead of that, you make an incision on the arm near the elbow at the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	If the corruption goes beyond this and encircles the elbow, then it is the death of the patient; to administer another remedy besides this for their cure would be a waste.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	Similarly, do the same for the foot when corruption affects not just the toes but also the sole of the foot; you must make an incision there and ensure it does not reach the ankle.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it reaches the arch of the foot, you must make an incision along its entire length.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if you can go in from above, then cut open the thigh down to the joint of the hip.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already reached the hip bone, then there is no cure but release; let the patient go and face death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	The way to cut open a limb or perform an amputation is as follows: you should tie a ligature above the area that needs to be cut, and apply another ligature at the desired location; extend the ministers by tying one on below each joint, and have the other minister extend their ligatures upwards. Then separate the flesh between the two ligatures with a sharp instrument until all the flesh is exposed; after this, it can be safely cut or amputated.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	Make sure to cover the entire area with clean linen cloth so that it does not touch the wound, and have a tight-fitting bandage brought to the patient, as well as some poultice for any abscesses.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if bleeding occurs while you operate, then cauterize the wound immediately or apply some styptic powder to stem the flow of blood; and afterwards return to your medical procedure until it is complete.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the affected limb with a suitable bandage, taking care that it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	I advise you to treat a man who has suffered an injury on his foot, this accident which I and you have noted, it is indeed a severe case of necrosis on his foot due to burning akin to fire damage.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And this accidental corruption first started on his toe, which spread to the entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	Therefore, that man should be prepared for the surgery to treat his injury with great caution due to the severity of pain and burning he experiences, and proceed to incise his foot up to the joint, aiming for a cure.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	This accident has caused the same corruption on his left hand's index finger for quite some time now.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	Therefore, you should come to me, and I will perforate this superfluity by applying my medical treatment upon his hand, thus purifying his body; but the superfluity is not relieved yet, it has now begun on another toe that continues up to his arm.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	He asked me to incise his hand, but I did not wish to do so due to my fears of the spread of this superfluity, and more importantly, because an incision on his arm might be deadly given how severe his condition is.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And after he recovered from my treatment, he returned to his land and I was informed that the man had indeed prepared and cut open his entire hand, and he was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	I have not added this narrative for any other reason but to be of assistance regarding what each part of this illness is and what it signifies, as well as how it should be treated.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	On the treatment of sinus issues and the importance of enemas with medicinal herbs.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in any fleshy part of the body and the space occupied by the abscess is prolonged so as to form a collection of pus, then it breaks open and perforates, discharging its pus, leaving behind an empty place like some hollow vessel, and what is spread over it with fine linen cloth, not having reached ultimate corruption, nor impressing upon any bone or nerve or ligament, such an affliction is called a sinus, and should not be named a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the space is prolonged so that corruption sets in any member, then it should be called a fistula and not a sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	Its treatment is that you should cut away the whole affected part of the body in the way it has spread out, and especially when it is thinly coated with a linen cloth, making sure not to leave any behind at the site because of its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	Here is the translation of the provided sentence: 
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then remove that with contempt; and do this for so many days until the cavity is cleansed and the pus has dried up.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	Sometimes enemas are administered with water and ash when this medicine is not available to you; it's about you taking the ashes of a beech tree, putting them in water; then use that and administer an enema to him until you realize that the cavity has dried up.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient has no tolerance for Egyptian medicine or water and ash, then administer an enema to him with water and honey mixed with ground juniper, and also with wine and honey blended; since the property of honey is that it cleanses and washes, and the wine makes the cavity adhere, especially when there is a surplus of astringency and dryness in the wine.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you do this sometimes and realize that the cavity has already dried up, then administer an enema to him with water which makes flesh grow in it.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	It is about taking the 'unguent dyafinicon' ointment and dissolving it with rose oil and astringent wine; or that you administer an enema to him with some other medicines and ointments which have properties that I have already written in the treatise on ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	Under similar circumstances where the hole is spacious, tie up its sides with thread and leave space for the introduction of an enema if necessary.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the patient's wound from which the arm protrudes is elevated to higher parts of the body, cauterize it in the lowest spot possible for the arm to enter it, because when the arm is constricted in a deep cavity, tissue may form inside.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if you cannot cauterize the cavity near the lowest part as desired, prepare the member so that the arm can flow out of it slightly according to what is available and make sure that there isn't anything stopping the arm from coming out.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	Apply consolidating medicines to the wound as needed for your purpose, placing them on a linen cloth above it.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And let the linen be as large as it takes to cover the entire wound; then cut with scissors right into the hole of the cavity a slightly wider slit than its own size; and extend over another fire-colored linen cloth according to the size of the slit, placing it far from the hole of the cavity so that arm discharge may be kept away from the large linen for some days at a time.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	Moreover, he who is above the navel opening, you will support at all times in order that this one does not allow what was put into his arm to come out.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so you may know whether what flows out of his arm is much or little, digested or undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And you must consider the place of this navel, whether the patient feels pain there or not, and if it is inflamed.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your treatment for such a condition is prolonged in this way, and you see the matter that was discharged over the navel opening already adhered or appropriately adherent, then on the third day you will remove the bandage or dressing, and upon removal of the wound covering, change the cloth for another one and renew the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if over the navel there is a small subtle space, then do not despair of its adhesion because it is appropriate for healing, since only some men are those who take long to produce flesh in their wounds, and others have the contrary effect.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if much undigested matter has come out of the navel for many days, then you know that it will not adhere; and if the adhesion of the navel is long delayed as well as the cause [of its delay], then adapt the medicines to drying out, and if the medicines are humid in their substance and in their virtue, they dry likewise like the ointment of dichondra when there is excess addition of wax.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	Here is the translation of the first source sentence: 
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	Here is the translation of the first source sentence: 
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Panarici is an abscess that appears beneath the nail of the little finger of the hand or foot; it rarely affects other fingers and when prolonged and hard to heal, or has become a phlegmonous ulcer or is corruptive, then with forceps extract what corrodes the root of the nail and often corrupts all the rest; and soon spreads its corruption to the bone in such a way that the odor becomes fetid, the extremity of the finger dies, and it blackens.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And so, when you have done what we said in the previous division and your cure is not successful, then it is necessary to cut away all the superfluous matter that remains of the nail and after this cauterize the wound immediately; for the cautery is very helpful in this condition.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is sound and the nail healthy, but its additions have already compressed the flesh to the separated parts within and began to press it and wound it, then you must place a thin rod under the angle of the nail that pierces the flesh, and drive this into it by cutting away the flesh with ease, and place on what remains of the flesh corrosive caustic medicines so that it is all consumed; then cure it with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	But if the corruption has already reached the bone, then you must cut into the bone and remove it, for there is no cure when the corrupted bone remains.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you see the corruption and decay spreading to the finger, then you must cut into one of the joints according to where it is pressed and remember its location; then treat it until it is cured.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if the nail receives a blow or injury and there is severe pain in it, then you must first bleed the patient, and then dry the nail with a sharp spatula by cutting it transversely from top to bottom, taking care not to penetrate too deep into the flesh beneath the nail, for this will cause intense pain and may lead to excessive scarring of the skin at that spot; afterward, treat that area with something that relieves pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	This small finger, which is naturally shorter in some people, has very little flesh and bones within it or underneath its nail.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	Some of them are born at the base of a joint, or their origin is in one of the joints of these fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	May he who is born in any parts of the finger not be ill, and as for him who was born in the joints let him suffer greatly.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And for those who are fleshy at birth, the incision is light, and you should insert the rasp with its broad side.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	May he who is born in the root of a joint be difficult to cure; therefore, beware of cutting into him.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	May he who is born in the finger's knuckles require that you insert your knife at the beginning into his flesh with a round incision towards the bone, then saw with one of those saws suitable for this, and then cure him until he is healed.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	May the unification that happens to fingers between their hidden parts or due to the man's birth who was born like this, or due to the consolidation of the plague or by fire combustion, or anything similar, then it is necessary for you to cut into that unification until the fingers return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	Then place between their sheets some rose oil to prevent them from uniting lightly, and separate those, or place a thin lead plate between them until they are united as needed.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And if there is a consolidation or hardening of tissue in some cases with the palm of your hand, then you must dry out that consolidated area according to how it has been prepared and adapted to fit the shape of the affected limb.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Regarding incisions for varicose veins," or "When it comes to cutting open varicose veins...
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Varicose veins are thick, coiled vessels full of melancholic excess that appear in the limbs of the body, and they occur most commonly in the legs, especially those who walk or work a lot, or carry heavy loads.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Therefore, you must administer a strong black-bile purge occasionally by forcing expulsion of the excess, and then bleed the patient from their basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	There are two ways of treating them with iron [implants]: one is that the incision be made and that black blood be drawn from it; the other way is to raise the vein and extract all of it.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The procedure should be done in this way: First immerse the leg in hot water until the thick blood from the limb is loosened and thinned; then bind the patient's thigh to the highest point of their groin down to below, with a bandage that goes underneath rather than on top. Then cut into the vein at one or two or three places, make an extensive incision, then gently draw out the black bile from below the leg up towards its upper end until you have extracted enough and removed all the disease-causing properties.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then bind him, and command him to refrain from foods that generate black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	Repeat the cure through bloodletting when the veins are full, and this makes the patient feel better.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	The lifting of their limbs is done in this manner: you who scrape the patient's leg, if there are hair on it, then put him in a bath and immerse the leg with warm water until it reddens and the veins become prominent; or if one has been exercised by strong exercise, without a bath being present, then scarify the limb.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	Then squeeze the tendon on the right side of the vein by cutting it on its length or behind him you must dislocate it, or at its base you must cut it.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	Then open the tendon with hooks and peel off the vein from all parts until you reach the nerves, and it must appear as you see this thread declining towards blackness.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And thus you will extract it, and from the tendon you see this white thing that is its cord.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	Then place that thing under it so that it is elevated and separated from the tendon, and suspend that with hooks through a lion's body.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then cut another section close to that section in three places, and then remove the skin from the area above the vein until it is visible.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	Then lift that [vein] and make an incision in the posterior section behind the ankle, then extract it and lift it out through the second section, and finally remove it from the section above.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	Do this until you extract it from the section that is the most superior or highest of all sections, once everything has been exposed; then make an incision in it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you don't obey and extract it by lifting, then insert a needle with a strong double thread and tie it to the vein and pull it out, or insert a rod underneath and rotate your hand in all directions until it is loosened.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	Make sure it is not cut [the vein]; for if it is torn, it will be difficult for you to extract the entire piece and this may harm the patient.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And once the entire vein has been extracted, place over the wound some wool soaked in wine and oils (rose oil and non-rose oils), and treat it until it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	Under these circumstances if the vein is contracted with a twist and does not follow its natural course as we have said, then it must be cut in all places of twisting and at the points where it is enveloped; then suspend that part with hooks until you elevate it completely.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	Be careful not to cut into the vein or harm it, as it will be difficult for you to elevate it later; use your discretion and act wisely in this matter.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	The shape of the instrument that cuts/sections the dried vein is as follows...
Forma de unci orp:	The shape of the hook-like instrument is as follows...
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not as sharp as the hooks nor does it have a pointed end so that it doesn't harm the vein; and it has flexible thickness, for if it were thin, it would cut into the vein due to its thinness; rather, it should be of excessive thickness as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	The extraction/removal of the leg vein is described below...
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs, in low-lying lands just as it happens in Atagia (in Arabic lands) and in the lowlands of India that are dry with little vegetation and where there is neither grass nor trees.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And it is easily generated in other parts of the body besides the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And the generation of it is due to putrefaction, which leads to the condemnation from within the body of serpents and worms, bringing in scary things and maggots that breed between the wound and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	A sign of the onset of this condition is the appearance of an inflamed vein on the leg, and subsequently, the area becomes blistered; then, from that blistering place, the vein begins to emerge, resembling a plant's root.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	Once the extremity of this condition appears, take a piece of lead weighing one drachma and tie it to that area; then, attach the lead to the leg and let it hang there.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	Every time you notice any movement outside the affected area, wrap it in lead and secure it.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	If the condition persists for a long time, then cut open one of its parts and wrap up the rest; but do not cut into the root cause of it that is external, because if you cut into that, it contracts and enters the flesh, causing an abscess and putrefaction at the site and a severe ulcer.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	For this reason, it is necessary that his wound be treated thoroughly and removed little by little, ensuring that nothing remains inside him at the rear end, and not leaving any cause within the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein, I have heard that it extends in some men for a length of five to ten inches, and I have even come across one that measures twenty inches.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is cut during the hour of its medication, then insert a pipe into its hole and perforate it with a long rod through to the body, ensuring that all matter is evacuated, and apply putrefaction ointment on the area for some days using medicine; then treat it for the cure of abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And sometimes this vein has many knots, and mostly when it appears at the joint of the foot or on the foot itself, and comes out with many holes, and I have heard that from each hole, a branch sprouts.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	Thus treat it as we have mentioned in the division, and with what has been said above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	On the topic of cutting worms that form under the skin, which is known as bovine disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	Here is the translation of the provided sentence: 
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	Here is my translation of your provided text so far, including the new first source sentence you provided: 
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared for its malice because when it goes into the body and rises to the head, reaching the brain, then it greatly opens in him and enters and destroys the brain, causing many fevers.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	So when you want to cure it and extract it, you must first observe its movement and appearance by feeling it, and then apply strong bindings above and below it with bandages, thus compressing it and extracting the excess.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is embedded in the flesh and you cannot find it, then place a hot iron with fire on the spot where it remains until it dies out, and the major feared consequence is its corruption which corrupts the place as we have mentioned.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	But if you see it reaching the head near the brain, then bind strongly over the eyebrow with a tight bandage and compress it to extract the excess; and it is necessary for the patient to undergo body purification with evacuating medicines that remove bad humors, and be cautious of foods that cause putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	On the surgery for nasal diseases.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And I have already seen that person whom I will recount to you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to attend a sick woman in a village. I uncovered her arm and observed a small inflammation on the vein of the upper arm; since it had been ruptured for an hour, I saw that inflammation gradually extend itself toward this [inflammation], but more slowly than could be expected, as if it were molten silver flowing from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	Then [the inflammation] proceeds away from that place into the muscle, and here I stop for one hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	Then it runs across to the other body before arriving at the other arm.
