Here is my translation of the text: 
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is inflamed, then leave it alone and do not touch it until the inflammation subsides.
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	And if the necessity arises to let out the blood gradually, and there is no excuse not to do so, then you may bleed that person on that spot or on the other arm in another vein.
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	When the vein known as the 'cord of the arm' is punctured in the place of the cubit or the basilica, either because they are not found or are hidden, for it is composed of those.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	And the quality of the phlebotomy for the patient is that they should immerse their hand in cold water while the fistula becomes red and the vein appears prominently.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	Then bind it tightly with a soft but firm ligature; and then perform the phlebotomy according to the small transverse dimension, not longitudinally or along its length.
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	Whether the opening is wide or your phlebotomy is such that you bleed it at the wrist, a little above the joint of the hand.
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	And if the flow of blood is hindered, then immerse your hand in cold water again and let the blood run into the water until you achieve what you need.
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	If you were in the days of summer, then you are excused from immersing your hand in cold water; but if it is winter, then place the body in warm water to temper its blood.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the phlebotomy of this vein is safer than all other veins, as there are no pulsating veins or nerves here.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And the phlebotomy of the ulnar vein on the right hand corresponds to diseases of the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	The procedure of phlebotomy involves lightly binding the hand with a cloth or your own hand, after immersing it in warm water until the vein has become engorged and is clearly visible to the incision site; then make a transverse cut and if you deeply pierce this vein, no harm will come to the patient.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	Take care not to harm your own hand during the phlebotomy, as only nerves lie there, stripped of flesh.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	Then immerse the hand in warm water again and let the blood flow into it; for if you do not re-temper it with warm water, the blood will congeal at the incision of the vein and its outflow will be obstructed.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	And when blood is extracted according to the required amount, then you place oil and salt over the vein so that it does not become immediately hardened; similarly, it is necessary for you to do this in all narrow passages.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	Since the benefit of phlebotomy on the left arm is more appropriate for diseases on that side.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And it is similar in phlebotomy on him as you have done on the other.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	The benefit of the cephalic vein in phlebotomy is for diseases that are on the upper parts of the body, just as with diseases of the head, and for retention of menses, and for diseases of the lungs and old ulcers on the thighs and legs, and also similar to other diseases.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	And the method of phlebotomy on him is that the patient puts their foot in warm water and rubs it until the veins appear; tie over the ankle joint with a strap; and at the place where the vein comes out, mark it under your finger, which will spread like tree roots across the surface of the foot.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	And therefore, a phlebotomist should use the largest branch and place it below their calf at the point of insertion because it is better and safer.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you perform phlebotomy on the surface of the foot, be cautious of the nerves that lie beneath it on the sole of the foot, and place your phlebotomy instrument across it as if you were about to incise it.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And let the phlebotomy vessel be ready.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	But it is forbidden to raise the blood; instead, you must immerse their foot in warm water and allow the blood to flow into that vessel until it is evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the phlebotomist misses on the first attempt, repeat with the phlebotomy instrument a little higher up because the area is safe; do not fear harming them, but be mindful of the nerves as mentioned earlier.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	Likewise, proceed with the other foot in the same manner.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And for the sciatic vein, the location, as mentioned earlier, is below the calf near the ankle of the popliteal fossa.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the benefit of bloodletting for him is relieving hip pain when it is caused by excess blood.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	The procedure of bloodletting is as follows: the patient should enter a warm bath, and then quickly and firmly bind their upper thigh from the side of the hip down to the ankle with a long, thin bandage that does not constrict.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And once it appears, you may then perform bloodletting in any way that is feasible and suitable for you, and what works best; either incise or section it, as the area is healthy.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	This condition is often found in men and is easily treated; if you find it, and there is no discomfort upon feeling it, then perform bloodletting on one of its branches, which appears at the back of the foot between the little toe and the ring finger.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	Be careful not to damage any nerves, and let out as much blood as you deem necessary.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	Then untie the bandage and place a compress over the bloodletting site, securing it firmly but gently, as it will heal quickly.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	De ventozacio means "Regarding cupping" or "On the topic of cupping." Cupping was a common medical practice during medieval times, so it is likely that this treatise will discuss its application and benefits. 
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Ventozas are either warts, or a disease, or made of glass.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	Ventozacion is done in two ways: one way is by scarification and bloodletting, the other is ventozacion without scarification.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	This ventozacion without scarification is done in two ways as well: either with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	There are 14 locations on the body where ventozas with scarification and bloodletting are administered. The first is in the alnocrati, which is at the back of the head; the middle one in two parts of the neck; ventozas under the jaw below the mouth; ventozas of two spatulas; ventozas on the forehead; ventozas from two phials and are made from two arms; ventozas from two nails, and those from two thighs.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	Ventozation does not extract blood from the large veins but rather from small ones scattered throughout the flesh, thus avoiding extracting virtue through them as happens with phlebotomy; nor is it necessary for ventozation to be done with fire or without fire in any illness caused by fullness until the whole body has been evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquella en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And thus, when you encounter any of these situations, and especially if it is during the third or middle part of the month, we command that cupping be performed after two or three hours have passed.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	The purpose of cupping at the nape is to relieve heaviness and pressure in the head, which often stems from an excess of humors that have settled into the veins; it is best for this to be done as a complete evacuation of the entire body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	This cupping site is located at the venipuncture point for the cephalic vein.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	It is not advisable for someone with a weakened constitution or suffering from a cold to undergo this procedure, as it can cause them great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	Therefore, this should not be done on the elderly or those with weakened constitutions, especially if they are suffering from chronic illnesses.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	However, there is often an oversight in this procedure, as the cupper may forget to place their hand lightly over the cups after application; you must instruct the cupper to do so, lest it cause an injury.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	Cupping on the forearm is done at the venipuncture points for the basilic and brachial veins; this can lead to asthma, constriction of the airways, damage to the respiratory organs, coughing, and congestion.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And now it is necessary to apply a small amount of ventosa alkehel (a type of medicinal ointment), because if it is placed underneath, it can cause weakness in the body and stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	The ventozacion of alhagdahan (a form of cupping therapy) is beneficial for relieving headaches and eye pain, as well as treating migraines, premonitory symptoms, and toothache. It serves as an alternative to basilic vein bloodletting.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	Make sure to instruct the cupping therapist not to apply excessive pressure during the scarification process, as this can damage the arteries and cause bleeding.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	Placing the ventosa (cupping device) under the chin is useful for treating mouth ulcers, gum infections, and various oral diseases. It serves as an alternative to bloodletting from the veins located in both lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	The ventozacion (cupping therapy) performed over the two temples provides relief for headaches, which occur due to an excess of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	The ventosa placed between the two thighs aids in bloodletting from three veins: the basilica, fusiform, and cephalic veins. It draws blood from all these smaller veins located closer to the skin's surface, with their numerous small branches reaching into larger veins beneath, allowing for extraction at the three main veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And instruct the cupper not to proceed with scarring, as the area is devoid of flesh and only nerves and arteries remain.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	It is a cupping glass that has been applied to the thigh and directed towards the hemorrhoids of the anus and the pus-filled ulcers beneath.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	Instruct the cupper to use a large glass cup made of iron, as this area requires a strong suction due to its sensitive nature; and ensure they have thin, delicate cups ready for those with weak veins who may be prone to scarring.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	Apply smaller cups to the legs for careful treatment, as they draw blood away from the entire body and relieve ancient pains of the lungs and heart, as well as the bladder; they induce menstruation, treat gout, and provide relief for both headaches and migraines; they serve in place of two phlebotomies on either side, along with another two at the elbows.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, they must be used cautiously as they weaken the entire body and may cause fainting in some individuals.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	The advantage of cups at the elbows is akin to the benefit gained from applying them to both legs.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of cupping position is that you place the cup at the beginning with an open end and suck for a short time, and do not prolong the duration of cupping; rather, place them lightly, and remove them carefully, so that humors come to the surface equally.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	Do not cease to repeat this process, continuing until you see the area turn red and swell, and when blood appears.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	Then you make incisions and continue the suction gradually, being mindful of the condition of the heart.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	For any man with delicate flesh prone to scars, it is best to make incisions only once and not more, so as not to cause ulcers in that area.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	Instruct the cupper to deepen the incisions slightly and lengthen them, while easing the suction.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	If the blood is thick, it should be incised twice; for in the first incision, the path of refinement for the blood and its moisture is opened.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second, there is careful inspection during blood extraction to remove its grossness.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very cloudy, then a third scarification should be performed so that it can be obtained.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	Finally, when we want to extract blood little by little or in small amounts, one scarification is sufficient for us.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want to extract a large amount of blood, we make a series of small scarifications; but if we know that the blood is thick, then it is necessary to scarify deeply.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	The term "scarification" only refers to the depth of the incision.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	If the person has thick, hard, dark incisions and their pores are tight, then the areas for cupping should be gently lubricated, widely opened, and swiftly resolved; if it is summer time, use aloe vera oil, violet oil, crushed almond oil, or goose grease; but if it is winter, then narcissus oil, lily oil, chamomile oil, or fresh blood, and others of the like.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superfluidity is thick and dark, then use red sandalwood oil, mint oil, aloe vera oil, or dill oil, and others similar.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	Here is the translation of the text: 
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And for someone whose blood is of a very moist nature, wash their bellies with sour wine or water from myrtles and sumacs and similar plants.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And for someone whose excesses are more severe, wash their bellies with old wine or water from costmary (which is sweet marjoram), or a decoction of dill, chamomile, and the like.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	Make sure the application of bellies is kept in place before bathing; then make sure it is administered immediately after the bath for an hour or two, and ensure they sleep with the application on.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What should be regulated when it comes to applying bellies to someone who has been bled before the application.
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	Consider this at the beginning: if the applier of bellies or the person who is to be bled has a choleric disposition and has sharp blood and inflammation, then they should take cooling substances, such as sour pickles, endive in sour wine and lettuce, wild radishes, peppermint tea, and similar things.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And let their food be things like chickens, the flesh of fat birds, and foods seasoned with sour sauces, and the like.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.

Here is my translation of the first source sentence: 
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	The translation of the provided text is as follows:

E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it is placed on the abscesses when they occur in their navel or stomach, because by virtue of strong attraction, a man's navel and removes the stone from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	Similarly, it is done when it is placed on the liver and spleen to alleviate windiness in those organs.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	These fomentation is administered with suction only, and some are administered using fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And sometimes they are administered full of cold water in diseases of the spleen.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	This is why the fomentation is filled and made larger; it is only cold water or water in which herbs suitable for this purpose have been cut.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of fomentation administered with fire: the size of the hole should be about two fingers wide, according to how we have formed it; and the amount of pressure is half a palm in length; and on its side, at the place where it surrounds the affected part, there must be one-fifth more than what can enter into it with a needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	It is made of goat or calf skin, with thick edges, smooth and clean, so that it does not injure the limb because of its position over it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And it is in the middle of a wooden or metal bar where a candle with fire is placed.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And this window is indeed much larger than the one we previously mentioned; and it will be smaller for those who are not very sick or of a certain age.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	The windows for children and exhausted individuals will be different from those used by the young or robust adults.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	The process of placing this window with fire on the body part involves setting up a small wooden grill that is adequately positioned in front of a small wax candle, and then placing it over the middle of the crossbar at the center of the window, ensuring the fire does not burn the patient's skin.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	Once it is placed on the patient's body part and our finger is positioned as mentioned earlier, when we have the windows ready and do not need to move our finger for steam to escape through that opening, then the window will be sealed.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And then move the wooden grill according to your needs, repeating this process if you require more of these windows.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is its shape: The larger this wind tunnel, the better, so it can receive a large quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	I assume you mean Chapter 97. Is there any text from Chapter 97 that I can translate or interpret for you?
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Leeches are not applied to every part of the body but only to those members where cupping is impossible because of their small size, such as fingers and toes, or parts deprived of flesh like the nose and lips.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And note that leeches found in putrid, dirty water are of inferior quality.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	Leave them in dirty water day and night until they are famished, without leaving any food inside their stomachs. Then empty the patient's bowels at the start with bloodletting and cupping, rub the affected member until it reddens, then place the leeches on it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they have filled their bellies and stop.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	If it is possible to draw off the fluid from this spot by cupping, this will be of further benefit.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the area with vinegar and then with boiling water; let it be rubbed and squeezed.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the body's blood has been drawn out by leeches and it continues to ooze, you wrap a cloth soaked in cold water around it until the bleeding stops.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the blood has increased in volume, then sprinkle ground vitriol or substances with astringent qualities over it until the bleeding stops; alternatively, apply hot bean poultices to the area and leave them on until the beans adhere to the skin and the bleeding ceases.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And now, if another round of leeching is necessary, it is possible to use new ones.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the use of leeches is not permitted, then rub the area with fresh blood or insert a needle into it until blood flows; subsequently, apply the leeches because they attach themselves as soon as they sense any blood.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to detach, sprinkle a small amount of ground aloe, salt, or ash over them, and they will fall off immediately.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio. 
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	O, my child, know that this chapter is scoffed at by foolish doctors and the common people, those who have never studied the books of the Ancients nor read a single letter from them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason, the practice of these scholars in our land has been kept private; I have never forgotten anything from it at any time, and I have not added what I have learned, but rather through a long study of the books of the Ancients and an understanding of their works, I extracted this knowledge.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	Then I applied my knowledge to experiments and studies throughout my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter all the knowledge that comes from my science and what has passed through my experience; since I have briefly written it down for you others and freed myself from a long explanation, and summarized it at the end of this summary; and I have shown it at the end of this declaration; and I have drawn in these illustrations the forms of instruments used therein, as is done by way of clarification, just as I did in two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	Chapter one.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememinationem membrorum fractorum et diversorum si uniscuiusque.

E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	Under the circumstances where there is a fracture, dislocation, or twist in the leg, you should immediately treat it by opening a vein to let out blood, or remove blood from any other part of the body if necessary; however, do not do so when prohibited for reasons such as weakness caused by low vitality, youth (children), old age (in decrepit condition), very hot weather, or extreme cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	He should then be fed with a diet of fresh herbs and small bird meats, such as pigeons or quails; avoid fatty meats and over-indulgence in food, especially those foods that cause blood congestion, unless you are sure the wound is protected from external infection (a clean wound), and there is no fear of the matter spreading to other body parts.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	Then return the patient to their regular lifestyle, as they were accustomed to before falling ill.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	When the broken bone starts to heal, it is necessary for the patient to be fed with nourishing foods that are rich in protein and heavy in weight, such as sticky porridge made from flour cooked in water, rice, beans, calves' feet, tripe, fresh fish, eggs, etc. This kind of diet helps coagulate blood faster around the fracture which expedites healing process and makes it more effective overall.

E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason, it is necessary to restrict the patient's diet; a diet that consists of heavy and viscous foods, as we have mentioned before.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	There is a wide variety of fractures depending on the different parts of the body.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor. E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	I will provide you with a detailed recollection of each type of fracture in its own separate chapter.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	There is also variety within the same body part for fractures.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	The types of fractures within the same body part are varied; there is the curved fracture and one that occurs in the joints; some are made according to the length of the bone: such as complete or incomplete fractures, transverse or oblique, comminuted fractures, depressed or not depressed, like when a skull is prepared for writing on it. Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Sign of bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And this is known as a bone fracture due to the bend in it, and that bump or elevation felt when touched, and its appearance under pressure from your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And if there is no visible bend in the affected area and you don't feel much pain upon touching and moving the bone, then it is not a fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil. E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	Know that if the affected area is bent and not split into two or has any other accidental damage, but only its corresponding parts are separated, then you should start to straighten it immediately before an abscess appears.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if the patient develops an abscess, then let it be until a few days have passed and the abscess subsides; Then dress it in whatever way you can with lightness and ingenuity.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	Know that the restoration of the patient's health, their treatment, is lighter than when this accident occurs.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then strengthen them according to how they will remember it.

But if the bone is affected, it's necessary to stretch this broken limb at its two ends, be it an arm or a leg; use your hand if the limb is small; or use two ropes or one rope and a hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And be in a position where you place the limb's location according to its natural shape, while the broken parts of the limb are stretched; then it is necessary that you make these additions return with ingenuity and in whatever way you can to their places.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And take care, according to your strength, not to cause the patient pain or injury due to your operation; and make sure, as much as you can, that you apply one bone to its companion in their best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	Under these circumstances you should now place your hand on him, and if you see any reason for doing otherwise then correct this and adjust it according to the strength of your skill.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	Avoid vigorous extension and compression as this can cause complications like infection or abscess formation due to the surgeon's carelessness, or it may lead to contraction of the limb as we have observed in such cases of their operations.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	Then apply appropriate connection, equalization, and careful operation along with the restriction of that limb, providing rest and tranquility; warn the patient about this and instruct them to avoid any movement or action that may harm it during their wakefulness and sleep, carefully observe their reactions and movements, and manage all his actions with your utmost skill; wait until the position of the limb is such that pain relief has been achieved, as this is what happens when there's a painful injury or damage upon positioning of the limb in any direction; then you must change it to another position where they feel no discomfort; ensure that their posture remains straight and even so that the limb does not become twisted during its restoration.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	The quality of the limb's restraint is as I recommend it to be; know that broken limbs vary in their size, magnitude and shape.

Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	For those who are obese or have large areas like the thigh or leg, it is necessary that the wrapping be made of strong and hard material. The binding should connect the large member with a tight grip all around, ensuring no dirt can enter.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	Then begin, start your evacuation procedure by placing a suitable dressing on the location of the fracture, using three or four wraps depending on the importance of the member. Tighten your hand slightly to secure the dressing.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	Then go to the upper part of the fracture site and tighten less so that your grip doesn't hinder blood circulation.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	Extend the wrapping slightly on the fracture site and loosen the grip gradually as you move away from the area.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	Take another bandage and wrap it around the area again, this time starting from below the fracture site. E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa. E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	Place another bandage over them and shape these coverings properly as well, whether there is a wound or a boil in that place, then put on it whatever reduces the boil and removes inflammation; leave this for several days; then you can tighten the stars [bandages?].

But note that the rod placed over this fracture should be thicker and closer together than the other rods; let the length of each bandage correspond to the limb's size and dimensions, then tighten them with another bandage according to your first binding; bind this well with thread as we said before on this topic of binding, and know that the more distant a point is from the fracture site, the less tight the binding.
