E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	Fine threads are not suitable as they will not allow you to achieve the necessary tightness with them and there should be less than a finger's width between the threads.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is weakened by the tightness of the threads at their extremities in those places, then place beneath them pads made from coarse flaxen cloth or felted wool so that it does not cause injury.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Some bone fractures are caused by blows, and occasionally there is a dislocation of the vertebrae; I will return to this in the second chapter with further details.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	Be aware that not every broken limb can be straightened with threads on the first day; this is because when the limb is large, it should not be bound with threads immediately but rather after a few days or more, depending on your assessment of the risk of abscess formation.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	This is how plasters were applied in the manner of the Ancients, which they placed over fractures, dislocations, and sprains.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	The common way of applying a plaster for bone setting is suitable for young children and women with delicate constitutions as it does not provide heat or cold: take some fine powder, this being the flour dust that accumulates on the walls of the mill due to the motion of the millstone.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And prepare it in this way, but add egg whites and beat the mixture until it is not too thick or thin; then use it.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another recipe for restorative plasters suitable for fractures, dislocations and sprains: Take equal parts of assafetida, ladanum, acacia, enula [elecampane], and myrobalans (or the root of wild pomegranate), with ten parts each of myrrh and aloe; twenty parts aloes [sic] oil. Grind and sieve these ingredients, then mix them either with aloes [sic] oil or egg whites if the patient's condition is open/ulcerated. Then apply this plaster, which has a good composition and will heal bones broken slightly, and benefit many people.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another recipe for a plaster suitable for fractures and sprains: Take ten parts of myrobalans (or wild pomegranate root), five parts each of aloe and myrrh, six parts acacia gum and two ounces of Armenian bole [iron-rich clay].
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	Grind all ingredients together in a mortar with great care, then sieve them and mix with either water or egg whites before administering.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	In this poultice, there is no restorative ingredient; it primarily serves to cure ulcers and expel pain.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another type of poultice that restores blocked conditions: take leaves from the fig tree and wild poppy; mix them together, then make a poultice from these ingredients.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	A condensed method for applying a poultice to aid the restoration of broken bones and to heal abscesses: take roots of marshmallow, chamomile, and violet flowers; add flour made from rye, all these ingredients are finely chopped and mixed with wine, unless the bone is scraped.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is scraped, then make this with moist cilantro water or simply water.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method for a stronger poultice to aid the healing of hardened abscesses that impede the restoration of an injured limb: take marshmallow roots and flax seeds; add bulrush pith, meadow-sweet, marjoram, violet flowers, chamomile, all chopped together then mixed with willow water or clean water or wine, whichever is most appropriate for the condition of the limb and its discoloration.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	In Wales, it has been seen that they are placed on the broken limb for its restoration and due to dryness caused by coldness there is also some lack of warmth in them as with myrrh, turpentine and similar things like those causes we have mentioned.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	A way to make a plaster that soothes injuries and pain: take millet seeds, cecity peels, human hair cuttings or bird feathers, marshmallow root, and salt, all in equal parts; grind them up and sift them through a fine mesh, then the plaster is made.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	The amount of time the bandage should stay on and then be removed is determined by considering if there's no pain, swelling, or bone breakage, ensuring it hasn't moved from its place; in such cases, you don't need to change it for many days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	If at the site there's severe pain, swelling, or inflammation, then you must treat it immediately by unwrapping and removing the plaster.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	Take a piece of cloth and a moist marine sponge, dip it in lukewarm water, and use this to wash the affected area until the swelling subsides and pain is eased; then let the limb rest for an hour; afterward, place soft wool soaked in vinegar or rose oil over it, wrap it up, and leave it overnight ensuring no abscess forms, reducing inflammation of the limb, and easing its pain.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat that subtle pressure and apply a small plaster, do not tighten it with your initial tightness, but make it delicate as the wound heals.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if you notice that the abscess, inflammation, pain, and all other symptoms have completely subsided, and the wound requires a plaster and a bandage no longer, then repeat this process as you did initially.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if no harm comes to the limb from any of the aforementioned causes, then do not remove the bandage for three or four days, or five, or seven; in some cases, it is left on for twenty days as per the healing process and the recovery of the limb, as mentioned earlier, until the fracture heals and the flesh coagulates over it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	Then adjust the bandage tighter than your initial tightness, accommodating the swelling of the patient's limb as their condition improves.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you see that the fracture site has dried out and is no longer receiving any nourishment, then know that it cannot heal properly. In this case, moisten it with cold water every time you remove the bandage; do so every three days. Loosen the bandage slightly to allow better blood flow to the limb, which will aid in its healing process, and it will recover faster.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	Furthermore, the mistake that foolish bone setters make when they do not set a fracture at the beginning as it should be done, and instead set it crookedly, is an error according to their operation, causing great fear, and if this were done properly, the Ancients in their books would have written about it.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	I have never seen anyone among them do this, which is why it is more reasonable not to attempt it.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter Two: On Fractures Occurring in the Head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The types of fractures are many, and their forms are diverse, with distinct causes. Some fractures occur due to the impact of space, where the force completely dislocates the bone from its socket, similar to how it affects the trunk of a tree, and this type is named 'ascial'. Others result from space piercing part of the bone, cutting through the flesh but not passing beyond; this kind of fracture is called 'levatio absoluta'.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	The severity of these two types of fractures can vary, with some being minor and others more severe. One type is caused by the impact of a heavy object or a fall onto a hard surface, similar in nature.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is penetrating, approaching the fatty tissue just beneath the bone or is on the surface of the bone; and the damage caused by these two types of fractures can be either severe or minor.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	When it comes to fractures that are impacted within the bone, at its core or in the thinner parts of smaller bones (like those found in the hands and feet), this specific type is called a 'capillary fracture'.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	Fractures caused by blows or the impact of stones and similar objects, which drive bone fragments into the surrounding tissue, are known as 'comminuted fractures'. They occur in hollow bones like those found in animals when they receive strong impacts on their joints.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	These fractures primarily happen in the bodies of people with weak bones or those prone to osteoporosis; they are also common in children's heads.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	All these types of fractures share similar symptoms: the affected areas become swollen and hot to touch; this is especially noticeable when treating open or compound fractures.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	I shall now provide further details on the treatment of these conditions.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	We know all these types of fractures by their detection, through physical examination and asking questions about the injury; we also identify them by observing any damaged or corrupted flesh on top.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	Under special circumstances when there is an exposed skull and it needs cleaning or covering with lint due to the fracture appearing black in color.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	When treating fractures, one must first consider the patient's initial condition and symptoms. If you observe signs indicating severe complications like vomiting of bile, fainting, loss of consciousness, vocal impairment, syncope, acute fever, swelling of limbs or a general worsening of these symptoms in severity, then the treatment is unlikely to succeed.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	If you notice symptoms that aren't severe or unusual, it is safe to assume a positive outcome and begin the treatment process.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The reason for this is that if the patient was infected at the beginning of treatment and it occurred during winter, you should expect a potential complication around day 14 based on all observed conditions.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	If the infection occurred during summer days, be cautious and prepare to remove bone fragments before day 7, ensuring no fat corruption occurs near the bones, and watch for any of the previously mentioned complications.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	Under the circumstances where you shave the head of an infected patient and expose it as much as possible, according to usual practice based on the shape of the infection, making sure that the weight is light upon the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	If you happen to detect bone involvement, a blood flow issue, or a severe infection and want to treat it cautiously, oppose the affected area with what covers it, fill the area with linen bandages soaked in wine and rose oil, let the infection rest until the abscess subsides, ensure that bleeding has stopped; then begin circumcising the bone and removing it.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	This could be done in one of two ways:
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	The first way is to insert the bone with a narrow straight chisel like this and then apply another one slightly wider than the previous. This is its shape:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	Then you would use an even larger chisel than the second one.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	You will need a good number of different chisels and some of them should be wider than others; furthermore, some should be shorter than the rest, being sharp at their ends, all made out of iron or steel.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use them to facilitate percussion on the incision so that you do not cut into the skull and cause brain damage.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	If the bone is strong and hard, you must first drill into it before administering the incisions with the trepans, which are called non-penetrating trepans.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not called that (non-penetrating) but rather so because these do not reach the limit of the skull bone beneath it, for when the trepan has a round edge or margin on what is below the top of the head like a small circle or rim, which prevents them from being submerged and passing through the thickness of the skull.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	It is advisable that you take a large number of these trepans, each suitable for the thickness of different skull bones, ensuring that they all have pointed ends and their length or width corresponds to the amount of bone thickness in those skulls.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	There are three types of trepans: The first type is used to drill into broken bone by placing the trepan on top and turning it with your fingers until you feel that the bone has been penetrated; then, switch to another location and insert whatever lies between all threads for about the thickness of a ray or similar object.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text into English: 
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And make sure with all caution that the scissors do not touch any part of the navel.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	Then, once you have encircled the perforating bone and separated it from the navel if it is attached to it, and extracted that part, you should trim and file down its roughness on the side where there is bone using another tool similar to scissors but make sure it is thicker and more delicate than other scissors.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if any parts of the small bones and sinews remain, then take them out easily with what you have as an instrument; and treat the wound with liniments and ointments which we have mentioned.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another way of operating is light and distant from fear, which was described by Gaulius and praised highly; this is how he describes it: It is necessary for you at the beginning to start exposing the part of the bone in the place where the fracture is most intense and visible. Once you have exposed that part and placed beneath it the tip of these delicate scissors with a curved shape...
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	If the lens-shaped part is sharp and does not cut anything, and the curved part of it is in two directions forward in length, sometimes; then let the lens-shaped part be adjusted to the navel with its cutting edge directed towards the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquella asperitat e erradiques aquellas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And now you must administer to yourself a portion of the reason with which you cut the bone at the beginning, using first the larger of those scalpels, and then use the finest one, without ceasing this action until you reach the innermost and most subtle part.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	In any other minor fracture, where there are small and subtle breaks, you must apply a cure according to what has been lost in the correction process.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	This is a reason that is not improved upon by all those who have studied this art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	Take note of what we have demonstrated in the case of major fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the skin is torn when you extract the bone, then take a cloth of similar size to the wound and submerge it in rosehip oil, place this over the wound; next, take another folded or tripled cloth that has been submerged in wine and rosehip oil, placing it on top of the first cloth with as little pressure as possible so as not to harm the nerves; finally, apply a broad bandage and do not tighten it more than is necessary to cover the size of the wound.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And you should make these powdered medications be applied over the wound, like so if they are dry; and universally administer any medicine that has cleansing properties and prevents biting.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	Take care to ensure that the wound is clean before you begin treatment; avoid using ointments or other substances, and do not allow any virulence (harmful bacteria) to accumulate there. This is because when these things are placed over the brain's membrane, it becomes corrupted and aggravates the illness, leading to further malicious harm for the patient.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	If the skull on the head becomes damaged and the bone is altered, especially when its treatment has been neglected or the cure has not been properly administered, and there is a darkening of its surface; then if any of these afflictions befall the patient which we have mentioned previously, you must know that their condition will worsen significantly.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas iii, e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	But if there is no darkness present but rather from the medicine applied on top of it and this medicine's nature causes such a darkening effect then make sure to use some wax, honey in one part, rose oil in three parts, mix those together with a piece of cloth, and place that over the skull. Then treat the patient further with medicinal spices until they are healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	On the restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Know that the nose is not broken but rather the two thin bones of the nasal bridge have been separated or one of them has been slightly displaced, as there are two such bones in it; since the part below [is] cartilaginous and cannot be actually broken, only deformed and rendered crooked.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	However, if one of the two bones is actually broken, then you should introduce your little finger into their nose and with your index finger correct that fracture from within while applying pressure to it externally until the nose returns to its original shape.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And this should be done with ease by you, take care not to hurt the patient during your operation.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the higher of the two bones and your finger cannot reach it, then you should use a needle that has been slightly thickened at its end.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in both bones, then you should do likewise.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And treat his restoration on the first day of the fracture if it is possible; otherwise, you must wait for the pus to subside.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	Then insert a piece of linen cloth into the end of the nose, if the fracture is in one part, or place two cow's horns, if the fracture is in two parts, and let the horn be of such size that it fills the hole of the nose.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And some of the ancient restorers say that the horns should be wrapped in leather and changed every day, but I have not seen this done; instead, it is better if the cloth is dipped in egg white mixed with powder from a mill; then leave the horn in place until the bone is set and the cartilage has hardened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And sometimes a quill can be inserted into the nose instead of a horn, especially if there is a risk of infection as it is wrapped in linen cloth; this method should be used when the nasal fracture is severe and the patient is not restricted from breathing.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	And this is not a necessary step for you to take; if you wish, you may use the quill, and if you prefer, you may proceed with the horns.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if another abscess occurs, apply a plaster made of wax or pitch infused in vinegar and rose oil, or use diaquilon.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	But if there is no abscess present, you must plaster the area with a mixture of wheat flour and powdered resin combined with egg white; then place on it a poultice of lion's fat, and do not blow your nose for any reason.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	But if the nasal bones are broken with a minor fracture or have become crushed, you must separate them and extract any small fragments using suitable instruments; then sew up the wound, treat it with an ointment that promotes flesh generation and hardening, and apply plasters appropriate for this purpose.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if there is an ulcer inside the nose, you must treat it with cow dung and insert lead tubes until it is completely healed.
Capitol .iiii.	It seems that "Capitol .iiii." refers to Chapter 4 in this medieval medical treatise. Is there another portion of the text you would like me to translate or explain?
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	On the restoration of the jaw when it is dislocated." 
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jaw is broken but there is no infection in the fracture, check if the break is only on the outer part and not split into two pieces with a curve inside; then this fracture is minor.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And now, if the fracture is on the right side, insert your left index finger into the patient's mouth; similarly, if the fracture is on the left jaw, use your right index finger instead; then push with that finger against the swelling of the inner part of the fracture while pulling gently from outside using your other hand; do this carefully to align both parts.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	If the jaw fracture has already split into two parts, then you must apply an extension to both pieces while trying to restore its original straightness as much as possible.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if there is tooth damage and disruption to the jaw, tie those teeth you wish to keep with gold or silver wire or with silk thread; then place wax over the broken jaw and cover it with a double layer of cloth, placing on top a large, appropriately-made bandage or a piece of sole leather as long as the jawbone itself. Finally, bind these together so they stay in place but avoid any further damage to the patient.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And command the patient to rest and remain calm, and give them a light diet, removing any harmful foods.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	If you notice that the patient's figure is distorted in any way, then cut and bind them on the third day; and proceed to rectify what has been altered, apply powder of mallow, egg white, or bran flour, for you will have removed their cerotae, and place woolen cloth over the plaster.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And so when the plaster is attached and adjusted to them, and the bone's position is not altered, leave it be, do not remove the plaster until they are healed and the fracture has strengthened; for many times this fracture will heal in three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another case of deep abscess occurs, then administer the treatments we have previously mentioned several times until they are healed and the abscess is drained.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is accompanied by a wound, consider whether it is a separated bone fragment or splintering; you must carefully remove those splinters with an instrument suitable for their extraction.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	Under these circumstances if the wound is narrow, then widen it with a fleam according to how much you need.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	Then when you have finished these procedures and no improvement has been made, then if the wound is wide you should sew it up; otherwise, place on it one of the plasters appropriate for this condition until it becomes healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	On the restoration of the collarbone when it is broken. 
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	Here is my best translation of your text into English: 
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	For when it is broken or separated, and also if the bones are not completely split into two pieces but still somewhat joined together in an unnatural way such that no ligaments are injured; or again, as sometimes happens, if there is a fracture with injury to blood vessels but without much displacement of bone parts; in these cases where there is little damage done to flesh and sinews surrounding it healing will take place quickly while those fractures accompanied by severe damages involve greater difficulty during treatment because they require more complicated procedures.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation for this kind of fracture (with injury to blood vessels) requires two assistants: one should hold and support the broken part while the other extends or stretches out the patient's neck towards that area.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	Then bind the fracture with these same splints, making sure it takes on the correct shape and does not stand out too prominently or sink into any hollows.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you need more extension, then place a pillow made of cloth or wool under the patient's chin, its size depending on how much extension is required; extend and raise their neck while shortening the circumference with your hand so that you can bind the fracture properly.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	If you cannot draw the end of the neck to the broken parts outside due to it being attached by tendons and ligaments (which would prevent such movement), then have the patient lie on their back with a medium-sized pillow placed beneath their neck.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the minister presses on the patient's muscles at these points until the bone of the furcula is elevated, which is above the breastbone. Then you correct the fracture and bind it with the aforementioned dressings.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	If you feel that the pieces of the furcula are jagged and uneven, it is necessary to make an incision over it and extract those jagged fragments with ease.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is retained within the bone, you devise an incision of it with one of the incisions you have prepared for this purpose. Because you had placed below the furcula the instrument that serves as a lever; and this is the instrument made of wood or iron which has this shape:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	It is similar to a scoop with this concave shape and its width should be according to what you have needed of it: in accordance with the size or narrowness of the bone.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	But its length should be as long as it is feasible for you during the operation; let there be two ends, and one end should be wide while the other is narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the rupture of the wound you have incised when extracting the jagged fragment from the bone is wide and you are certain of suppuration, then you should adjust both lips of the wound with sutures.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the rupture is minor or you fear infection, then fill the wound with cloth and powders according to the size of the incision.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if an infection occurs, dip cloth in vinegar, rose oil, and wine, then place it on the affected area.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	When the bone is exposed due to the wound or fracture, place a plaster made of flour and egg white on top of lion fat; then apply the sphere underneath the patient's eyelashes if needed; take some earth as long as the Saracens' turban, which should be about one palm in width, and sprinkle double the amount of powder over the fat and plaster; take a thin wooden board with a width of three fingers and similar length, wrap it with cloth along with the aforementioned board on the location of the fracture, apply another layer of earth as previously mentioned, then roll this around the patient's neck underneath their eyelashes and place the contraption on every side of the body part that has been fractured; do this whenever the tightening of the fracture increases in severity, and now you know all there is to it.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not loosen the ligature unless you notice an abscess or inflammation in the specific location within twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	Then renew the plaster if you see that his condition is improving due to this treatment, tighten it in place, and restore what has been broken until the fracture of the fork (collarbone) is healed.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And let it be tightened and healed according to the month within twenty-eight days; in some men, this can be done in less time.

De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	Regarding restoration or treatment of shoulder fractures." 
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	Spatula tart is broken in its place inside him and it's not totally broken of him, but only its edges.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And when his place is broken - and it's broken in the middle of him - and it's not known except by touch, then according to the figure of the fracture make you its preparation and reduce that according to its natural shape with all kinds of ingenuity that are possible for you.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	Then place on the spot powder of eggshell and beeswax; then place a cloth pad over it, doubled; then lay upon him a thin slice of smooth board according to the amount required for the whole spatula or more if necessary.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if you leave the board with a concave spot in any of the places of the spatula, then fill that concavity with beeswax, and then raise the board according to evenness.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	Then strengthen above with a long bandage with decent tightness and the stability of the board until it is not moved from its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	Consider the binding every day; and whenever it is loosened, bind it again and tighten it, and level the board if it has moved from its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And turn the patient onto their side.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	The spatula is replaced after either twenty or twenty-five days.
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And when this number of days has passed, you untie the bindings and know for certain which bone has been neither damaged nor dislocated.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you proceed to the place of a broken bone and apply an iron chain there, then you cut into it, open it up, and do as we have said in dealing with the fracture of the humerus: treat any abscesses that may occur.

De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	On the restoration of a broken foot.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The foot, in some cases, is broken at its middle and this tends to happen; but more often it is the ends of it that are dislocated and crushed.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	Regarding the complications of such an injury: when the middle part is broken, it tends to cause severe pain in breathing and coughing, as well as difficulty with urination or vomiting blood; the broken bone ends can be felt within the cavity.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	Here is my attempt at translating the text line by line: 
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat. Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	Regarding the restoration of ribs when they are fractured or dislocated.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	Know that fractures of the ribs only occur in thick or prominent areas along the back, and dislocations do not happen at their tips towards the front because they are cartilaginous there.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And its diagnosis is not hidden from your feelings, you must examine it with these said tools.
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And the restoration should be such that it aligns the fracture with these said tools as best possible, ensuring it is aligned as needed, then plaster and strengthen the broken bone with a splint if required.
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	If the fracture of the ribs extends towards the armpits, then the patient will experience severe pain and stabbing sensations, much like that experienced by someone with pleurisy, and this is due to the bone piercing the membrane; they will also suffer difficulty in breathing, coughing, and vomiting large amounts of blood; this condition is difficult to cure.
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And the Ancients have designed many ingenious devices for this purpose.
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And regarding this, he says: it is necessary to remove the food of the patient that produces inflammation and gas, so that the abdomen becomes inflated and extended, pushing the hernia out.
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	We would have hoped that this would not be a light cause to produce superficial abscesses, but if it already happened, then it helps with that.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	And some of them said that it should be placed on top of the gas and then squeezed strongly; this seems reasonable, but there is a fear that the gas will push the superfluous fluids to the weak spot.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	And some said: the place should be covered with wool that has been soaked in warm oil, and powders should be placed between the ribs before filling it up, ensuring that the bandage is tight like a round covering; then the patient is treated for pleurisy with food and medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	If a strong cramp afflicts the patient who is not suffering, and the bone breaks through the covering with a puncture wound, we fear for the patient; then it is necessary to make an incision over that spot, exposing the broken rib, and place upon it an instrument that retains its shape (a splint), as previously mentioned, and easily cut away the bone, extracting it.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	And then, when we align the two lips of the wound, if it is large, we use sutures, and treat it with plasters until it heals.
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	And if there is an abscess inside [the wound], treat it by dipping in rose oil powder and place it over the area, ensuring the patient is cured with what covers the abscess inside.
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	Let him lay on his side while sleeping until he is healed.
Capitol .ix.	It appears that this text has moved to a new chapter or section, indicated by the "Capitol .ix." heading. This likely signifies Chapter 9 of the treatise.
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	On restoring fractured vertebrae of the spine and neck." 
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Sometimes it happens that there is a fracture in the bones of the neck, and then it affects their coating, and similarly with the vertebrae of the back.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And when this happens to someone and you want to know if they will recover or not, consider this: if you see their limbs already weakened, numb, and lifeless, unable to move or exert strength; and when you squeeze them with your fingers or prick them with a needle without causing any pain, then you should know that they are not healed. In such cases, it is considered fatal.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	And if they can feel the pressure of your fingers and are pricked without pain, then you know that the neck bone is saved and the patient will recover.
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	And if you see similar symptoms in the vertebrae of the neck and want to know if it will heal or not, then consider the patient's feet.
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	When you see that their feet are already numb and the same happens to their limbs, then when they lie down on their back, watch for windiness and a lack of self-control in their bodily functions; sometimes, they will be turned over onto their back and want to urinate but cannot. In such cases, it is considered fatal, and you should not attempt to treat them.
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	However, if none of these causes occur, the cause is better and more minor.
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	And the treatment for it is to pierce and drain the abscess by placing some ointment or a compress soaked in warm broth on the affected vertebra; apply to that area several times a day until the abscess has drained.
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	Then apply one of the invigorating and strengthening plasters, pressing it gently onto that area; instruct the patient to rest and remain calm, and not sleep on the painful side until they are healed.
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	And if it happens that the thigh bone becomes dislocated or any other cause arises which separates it, then you must cut above the joint and extract that bone; then rejoin the two edges of the wound, with sutures if necessary; and treat that area with an ointment made from plant juices until healed.
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	But if the lower part of the thigh bone is broken and it's at the end of the shaft, then you must insert your left index finger into the anus and align the broken bone with your other hand as best as possible by manipulating from outside; then apply a plaster and splint, using both if required, and bandage that area tightly.
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	And if you feel shattered bones in them, then operate on that area and remove it, treating the wound with a treatment that precedes healing.

De restauracio de la ancha.	On the restoration of the hernia." 
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura. E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	And for their restoration, you should stretch out your hand over that area above the fracture as shown in the illustration.
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	And if the fracture is only at their extremity, then you should bind that part according to what appears suitable in the equation, making it equal to what assembles their natural figure.
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	However, if the fracture is in their back or has affected the lower parts, then you should make the patient lie on their stomach so that you can prepare for the restoration of that fracture.
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	And once you have bound that part, place a plaster over it, then place a wooden or metal splint on top, and secure it tightly without fear of piercing the fracture or dislodging the bone.
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	Bind the cavity with something that fills that space so that it maintains the tightness according to equality, and command the patient to sleep on their back or side.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	However, if there is an occurrence of an abscess, then you should cease the extension and restoration process until the abscess has been subdued, place on them whatever alleviates it as previously mentioned; then return to their restoration, securing that part accordingly.
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	And if it happens that the bones are broken or shattered, then you treat them.

De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	Adjutori is what we call that area between the elbow and the head of the shoulder.
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	And if it is broken, its restoration can be done in one of two ways. [Further instructions or explanations].

[Describe what happens next or provide a conclusion to the procedure].

Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut. But if an open wound occurs, then leave the bandage in place for seven days and apply a poultice of moldy wool soaked in vinegar and rose oil over the wound until it heals, before pulling on that area again.

The way to pull on it is by applying a plaster cast over the fracture and then wrapping a bandage of new cloth around the cast. E lahoras usa de stelhas.	And then use crutches.
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And make sure you place over the fracture that crutch which is thicker and stronger than the others; leave a finger's breadth between each crutch, and let the length of the crutches be according to the break with an addition of three fingers on either side.

E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	And if the break extends further, make the binding looser accordingly.
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay. E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you fear the development of an abscess, then leave the binding and crutches in place for seven days as we have described.
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	Here is my translation of the provided text:

De restauracio de fractura del bras.	De restauracio de fractura del bras.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	Arms are composed of two bones which are called the ulna and radius; of these one is small, this is the bone that receives the little finger, and the other is large, this being the one on which the little finger rests below.
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	And sometimes only the larger bone is broken or just the smaller one, but often both are broken together.
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	And when it is the smaller bone that is broken above, then its restoration is light and healing of it is lighter.
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	And when the larger bone is broken below, its fracture is bad and healing of it is difficult.
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	But worse still is when both bones are broken together.

Then place your tourniquet over the fracture site as tightly and forcefully as possible. E les draps que so envolopatz sobre la fractura sian draps mols humitz, e no sian durs ni aspres, e·l fiel am le qual es strenhut sia de li propriament migier entre subtil e gros, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And the bandages that are wrapped around the fracture should be soft and damp, not hard or rough. The tourniquet that is tightened should be made of material that is precisely halfway between fine and coarse, as we have recommended.
E considera le membre e·l liament aprop alcus dias.	And consider the limb and its movement after several days.
E si accideys alcuna causa de la qual rectificacio es necessaria, ayssi cum prusiment le qual accideys al membre, e lahoras cove que tu enbroques le membre am aygua cauda entro que cesse aquel pruziment.	If any cause of correction occurs that is necessary for the limb's movement and this pain happens to the limb, then it will be beneficial for you to immerse the limb in warm water until this discomfort ceases.
E leysses le membre no costreyt entro que repause, e aprop torna la strictura.	Leave the limb unrestrained so that it may rest, then replace the tourniquet.
E si la extrictura ja es mollificada e l’os ja es remaugut e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras rectifiqua tot aquo am la tua vertut.	And if the tourniquet has been loosened and the bone is already softened and resembles those [bones], then rectify everything with your skill.
E considera mays si le nutriment es prohibit pervenir al membre per superfluitat de strictura, quar lahoras cove que mollifiques aquel un petit e laysses aquel per alcus dias entro que corra ad aquel le nutriment, e aprop strenh aquel.	Consider carefully if the tourniquet is too tight and thus preventing nourishment from reaching the limb; in this case, you should loosen it slightly and leave it for a few days to allow circulation of nutrients, then tighten it again.

E aprop sia suspenduda la ma del malaute per la sua vertut de movement agitatius, e fay aquel dormir sobre le sieu dos.	Then the patient's hand should be suspended to restrict its agitated movements, and make them sleep on their back.
E sapias que aquesta fractura es restaurada en xxx dias o en xxxii dias, o fort leu es restaurada en xxviii dias, e tot aquo es segon la disposicio de las compleccios e las disposicios de la vertut.	Be aware that this fracture heals in approximately thirty days or thirty-two days, but with strong care, it may heal within twenty-eight days, and all of this depends on the patient's constitution and the strength of their body.
