De curacio de anca dislocada.	Of the treatment of a dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the joint of the hip and the junction of the muscle can only be dislocated and not damaged like other joints with small displacements and concavities.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	The hip joint can be dislocated in four ways: it can move outward or inward, forward or backward.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	It is most often dislocated outward or inward, but rarely forward or backward.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	The sign of dislocation outward is when you align the patient's affected leg with their healthy one, it becomes longer and the knee is more prominent compared to the healthy side; the patient cannot bend their foot inward and this area may be swollen due to a build-up of pus as the head of the hip bone has already arrived here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	The sign of the patient who has an outward dislocation is that their symptoms are opposite to those mentioned above.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	The sign of the patient who has a forward dislocation is that they spread their leg as much as possible but cannot bend at the knee due to pain; if they attempt to walk, they cannot step forward and must use crutches. Their urine flow may be interrupted, leading to swelling, and walking is only possible using crutches.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And a sign of the one who experiences dislocation in their hip joint is that they cannot extend their thigh, nor can they bend what was previously bent at the knee; their leg becomes shorter than the other and the knee softens, with the head of the femur displaced from its socket.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	The only reduction in the types of this dislocation is that you consider it, then if the dislocation is old and ancient, having been like that for a while, you administer its reduction and leave it as it was disposed; in which case there isn't total healing and therefore no further treatment should be performed on it.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	But in the case of someone with a recent dislocation, which is one of four types of dislocations, you should consider returning the joint to its place and extending it inwardly and outwardly, as well as on both sides; for often this alone suffices and no other treatment is needed.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	If it does not return with this method, then you must prepare a strong minister (helper) who will extend the patient's leg from below or by holding their hands or tying what is tied over the thigh; another minister extends the patient's hand so as to place their own underneath theirs, and at that point they should strain using a belt around the root of the hip joint. And let another minister hold the end of this belt.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And if there is an extension of it or from the part within that pains at the part of the fork, or from the back to the part of the spine.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And for the extension of all these, at once have the patient raised by their body from the ground and let them remain hanging.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this type of extension is special for all four [limbs].
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And so if the dislocation returns to what we have said [previously], it will be good; but if not, then it is necessary for this specific type of cure that I shall now explain.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the specific reduction when it is dislocated, and the dislocation occurs at the inner parts, have the patient turned onto their side; then place the straps over the top of the hip bone in that area between the head of the femur and where it pains; now extend the strap above the painful area to the highest part of the fork (i.e., the shoulder).
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	Then have another strong assistant take the patient's arms, and pull hard on the thick part of the dislocated hip and extend [the leg] outwards with violent extension, for this will return it to its place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this type of treatment is less invasive than other methods as it reduces the need for surgery on this body part.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	If you find yourself unable to comply and do not follow the instructions for this treatment method, then ensure that both of the patient's feet are securely tied together with a strong yet light binding, above the heel and below the toes.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And let the length of each be equal to about four fingers, and let the patient's leg on that side be extended further than the other by about two finger widths.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	Then the patient should be suspended over the top of a pole or post, and let them hang there securely; let their body's length from the ground measure about two yards.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And instruct a strong young man to push down on the head of the hip joint, and let another young man be suspended with the patient, pulling up on the other hip with force, so that the joint returns swiftly into place.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	However, during the reduction process itself, when there is dislocation outwards from the joint, it must be that the patient remains on their fist as previously advised for swelling; and let the binding over the affected leg and foot be tightened accordingly.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And then two sticks are placed, one under the patient's feet and the other on their head; then adjusted sticks are placed in the middle of a poultice wrapped with wet cloths to prevent the patient from being harmed by the sticks between their legs so that the extension of these parts below is not pulled.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	Then each assistant extends to their respective position while the doctor places his hand according to the reduction technique.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if you obey the reversal, it will be very beneficial to you; otherwise, place emphasis on that diligently and thus what we have said in sadness for not complying.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	Make sure the patient rests quietly on their side.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is in front of you, make sure the leg is slightly extended; according to this description above on the poultice, have the doctor place his right palm on the patient's affected joint, then take that and extend it gently down towards the lower parts.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	If the dislocation is in back of you and it's not necessary to extend their lower parts, then have them elevated from the ground; however, they should be placed on a hard surface, just like we mentioned before for the examination when their hips are dislocated outwards according to what we said about placing them over two planks. And while they're on their stomach, have their limbs extended as described earlier.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And now it is necessary to apply compression with a board on the area where the joint is located.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	So, once the reduction is complete as it should be - and you won't miss the sign of the reduction in him, which is when you extend the patient's legs, and when you see his legs become equal and he draws back his knee without protest, then you'll know that the limb has been returned to its proper place - now adjust two cushions and apply a plaster cast and remove with bandages so that no part of the body is squeezed; keep the patient at rest for three or four days.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	Then remove the bindings and plaster cast, and compare one leg to the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	If you see that the legs are now equal in appearance, then you'll know that the dislocation has been corrected, and so let the patient go.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any signs of softening, then return and plaster that limb again, removing it according to your original structure, and keep it for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	Then remove the plaster, and have him delay walking on it for a few days until he is comfortable.
Capitol .xxxii.	Sure, here is my attempt at translating the provided text into English: 
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	De curacio de dislocacio del denolh." 
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The shoulder is dislocated in three ways: it is dislocated outwardly, inwardly, and behind the joint; it cannot be dislocated forward.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	The sign of a dislocation is when you ask the patient to put their leg on their hip, and if they can't do it, you know that the shoulder is indeed dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	To restore the shoulder in all three ways, make the patient stand straight and have them extend their arm if they can; place your hands on their face and put their foot between your feet; then hold their shoulder with your palms and grasp it firmly between your thumbs over their shoulder; meanwhile, another assistant should extend the patient's leg until the shoulder returns to its socket.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	The sign of successful restoration is when their arm sticks to their hip without effort.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then plaster that area and attach the arm to the hip, binding them together with a bandage for three or four days; then untie the bindings.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	Do not let the patient walk for a few days until they are healed and comfortable.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33. 
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	From the cure of the dislocation of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	Sometimes the ankle is sprained due to a small displacement, and sometimes it is dislocated completely, with the dislocation occurring either within or outside the joint.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	The sign of an ankle dislocation is that sometimes the affected area becomes swollen, proceeding from the joint to the side where it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	Mostly the cure for its sprain is a slight reduction [of the ankle], and it should be extended with ease using your hands and wrapped so that it can heal.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	In the cure for a complete dislocation of the ankle, it is necessary to have the patient lie down straight, and they should have a strong and valiant assistant behind them in their mid-section.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	Then you will have your right hand on the uppermost part of their foot and your left hand on the lower part of the foot in the area of the ankle.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And then you will pull the foot towards yourself with your right hand and [then] twice with your left hand, and extend it to the left; finally use the toes of the foot with your right hand under the leg without strain.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do this twice as we have counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	Then wrap the foot around the leg for the third time, you are at the ankle.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Therefore, if upon returning once or twice in this manner you see the foot wrap correctly, it is good; otherwise, repeat the operation as the ankle will return.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if it is prohibited for you to perform the reduction as we have recounted earlier, then make the patient lie on their back on the ground. Place a long stick in the ground firmly and position it between their legs. Ensure they are wrapped in cloth so that the patient does not catch cold.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	Then have the assistant hold their legs and another minister extend the foot with both hands or something similar to pull on it; stretch each of them in opposition to the extension of their limb, and let the stick be between the patient's legs holding that position so that the body is not pulled away from where they are underneath.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	Then the physician should pull on the dislocated joint with both hands while another assistant holds the healthy side of the body to prevent any further displacement as it is returned easily.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And thus, when the dislocation returns and you restore their health by reducing it, then apply plaster and secure it tightly with linen strips, and bind the foot to the leg with a bandage.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	Be mindful to avoid or protect the nerves which are located behind the ankle bone, as you do not want the bandage over that area to be too tight and cause harm.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	Then leave it like that for two or three days; if the bandage has softened, remove it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And on the third or fourth day, untie it and forbid the patient from walking for forty days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	However, if they are forced to walk before that period of time has passed, it is certain that the dislocation will not be completely resolved and healed, and thus it may not respond to treatment.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	If an acute abscess occurs, you should administer the treatment as previously described in this account, but in a different location for healing and anointing until it is improved.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	It seems that this indicates the end of the text or a new chapter/section. In modern formatting, you might see "Chapter 34" or something similar to indicate a new part of the treatise.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	Cove que aquel qu'es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in one of the joints of the foot, then you must have the patient sit on the floor or a table, and keep him that way as though he were walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	Then stand by the patient's side, place your foot on what projects from the joints, then press that with your foot vigorously until it returns to its socket, and you see it level again without protuberance.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	Then place under the patient's abdomen a table that fits around the foot entirely, which has two ends, and then bind that with binding that is tight yet firm for three days; then unbind it and make him rest from walking for many days until his recovery is ensured.
Capitol .xxxv.	It seems this medical treatise consists of numerous chapters, with the last message being Chapter 35. Is there another portion you wish me to translate?
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the kinds of dislocations that occur from blows or fractures or any other cause.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any of these causes occurs, and you are engaged in the cure and restoration of it, many times death succeeds.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	Certainly! Here is my attempt at translating the provided text:
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And so, exert yourself quickly to perform the reduction at the beginning of the procedure, before it develops into a dangerous abscess.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And if the limb returns to its desired position, then administer treatment that prevents the dangerous abscess and heals the wound with what you deem appropriate from among the drying medicines.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	If there is dislocation with fracture and the bone ends become separated, then you pierce the membrane of their joints, and do as we have said before for simple illnesses in those areas.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And be mindful to avoid using instruments on the paths of fear according to what my teachings have instructed you; for this is better for your true self and Creator, and brings greater glory to yourself, and more wholesome benefits to your body in due time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus ends the words of Albucasis, for which may God bless us.
